something very strange is happening to the body it... it seems to be fading out of existence!
Pierced by shards from an exploded Burner anomaly.
Found dead with symptoms of intense radiation poisoning.
Crushed under heavy debris. Probably didn't see it coming.
Caught in a chemical anomaly, body severely corroded.
Multiple puncture wounds, likely from a pack of pseudodogs.
Body found with severe burns, close encounter with a Burner anomaly likely.
His armor's fused to his skin - fatal encounter with an Electro anomaly.
Found in pieces. Signs point to a Vortex anomaly engagement gone wrong.
Completely drained of blood. Classic signs of a bloodsucker attack.
Skull crushed, possibly by a pseudogiant. The ground is still stained.
Death by decapitation. Suspect a well-aimed blow from a controller.
Caught in the aftermath of a psy-storm. Not much left but scorched gear.
Splattered by something big. Only chunks left. Possible Chimera attack.
Body riddled with shrapnel from a nearby grenade blast.
Found with his guts out. Likely an unfortunate run-in with a pack of snorks.
Sudden cardiac arrest. His PDA logged increasing panic before a silent end.
Impaled by a massive spike; probably walked into a booby trap.
Drowned in swamp waters. Mud and algae clogged his filters.
Body found contorted and frozen; victim of a Whirligig anomaly.
Severe trauma with multiple fractures and internal bleeding, likely fell from a high place.
Looks like a severe case of electrocution. Maybe he didn't notice the live wire.
The body shows signs of advanced hypothermia. He must have been exposed to the cold too long.
There are deep burns all over the body; looks like he was too close to an exploding barrel.
An apparent animal attack; the marks resemble those of a bear... or something bigger.
It's a grotesque sight: the body is twisted in an unnatural position, limbs bent at impossible angles.
His suit's radiation indicator is off the charts. Must've stumbled into a highly contaminated zone.
Death by asphyxiation; looks like he choked on his respirator.
Body found half-submerged in acid; the remains are grotesquely disfigured.
Multiple bullet wounds suggest a close-range firefight. Casings everywhere.
Fatal wounds appear self-inflicted. Tragic end in the face of hopelessness.
Seems to have been caught in a powerful explosive trap. Bits of metal embedded everywhere.
Ripped apart by some beast. His recorder captured the roara chilling last memory.
The body is bizarrely mummified. A nearby artifact might be responsible.
Found near a psy-field, his expression frozen in terror. Psychological trauma evident.
Neck snapped. The ground shows signs of a struggle with humanoid tracks leading away.
The chest cavity is crushed; impact from a high-velocity projectile is likely.
Deep lacerations filled with foreign biomass. Possibly attacked by some flora mimic.
Severe lacerations around the face and neck. Death by a bladed weapon is likely.
Looks like an execution-style killing. A single, clean gunshot wound to the head.
Skin and flesh are petrified. Exposure to a rare stony artifact could explain this.
Skull shattered like a dropped melon, courtesy of a pseudogiant's stomp.
Mauled brutally, guts unraveled over meters; a bloodsucker's feast.
Looks like he screamed until his lungs burst. Gas anomaly's silent but deadly.
Blown into chunky salsa by a grenade trap. Watch your step in the Zone.
Turned inside out by a Whirligig. Nothing left but a bloody pulp with a badge.
Half his body charred black, other half untouched. Electro anomalies don't give a damn.
Eyes bulging, throat crushed. Looks like a controller got a hold of him.
Torn limb from limb, pieces scattered like breadcrumbs. Snorks had a party here.
Corpses stacked up like firewood, bullet holes everywhere. This was a massacre.
Neck snapped at an unnatural angle, eyes staring blank. Fell from the sky, or maybe pushed.
Found impaled on a tree branch. Flying anomalies aren't just myths.
Skull cracked open, brain gone. Either a desperate zombie or something far worse.
Face melted off with acid. Some stalker's last words were probably 'what's that hissing noise?'
Chest exploded from the inside. Booby-trapped artifact or an internal bomb? Ugly way to go.
Lower half missing, upper half a horror show. Minefield, or something dragged him under?
Bones crushed to powder, yet skin not breached. The power of a gravitational anomaly.
Lacerations all over, deep enough to expose bone. The new mutants aren't messing around.
Found draped over a fence, electrocuted. Must've thought the grass was greener.
Stomach torn open, innards missing. Predators here don't waste their food.
Burns and slashes suggest a close encounter with a Burner and a Blade anomaly combo meal.
He's fuckin' dead, a complete goner. Looks like he took a nosedive off a cliff while running from God knows what.
Flesh Eaters turned him into a chew toy. Limbs and bits scattered like a fucked-up jigsaw puzzle.
Caught a face-full of anomaly. Skin's gone, just a grinning skull left.
Gutted like a fish. Whatever did this had claws sharper than your ex's tongue.
Zapped by a goddamn Tesla. Crispy as fried chicken, but not half as tasty.
Bashed his head in with a rock, or something did. Brain matter painted all over the damn place.
Looks like he exploded from the inside. Nasty shit, body parts flung out like confetti.
Decapitated. Head must've gone rolling because it's nowhere fuckin' seen.
Electrocuted till his eyeballs popped. Never piss on electric fences, kids.
Body's all twisted, bones sticking out. Damn anomalies making modern art out of stalkers again.
Something sucked his guts out through his ass. Zone's weird as fuck.
His torso's on this side of the road, legs on the other. Must've been one hell of a last split.
Looks like he swallowed a grenade. Internals are now externals.
Riddled with bullets like Swiss cheese. Guess he fucked with the wrong crowd.
Hit by lightning, fried to a crisp. Smells like barbecue, but trust me, don't eat that shit.
Throat slit so deep he was nearly headless. Some Harry Potter level of horror right there.
Chopped up and spread out. Guess whoever did this didn't want him to be lonely in the afterlife.
Half-eaten by something big, half-buried by someone lazy. Classic Zone cleanup.
Poisoned, then left to rot. Even the rats won't touch him, and those fuckers are desperate.
Fallen from a high place, splattered all over. New rule: don't walk your drunk ass near cliffs.
Caught a fuckton of shrapnel to the face. Looks like a goddamn meat grinder went to town on him.
Looks like the poor bastard tried to fist-fight a Bloodsucker. Guess who won? Hint: not the dumbass with his throat ripped out.
Burned to a fucking crisp. Walked into a Burner anomaly like a total noob.
Fucking electrocuted. Found him clinging to a fence, fried like a chicken at a barbecue.
Smashed by something big. Body looks like it's been hit by a bus, not that we have any of those fuckers running in the Zone.
Chewed up by Snorks. They did a real number on him; left more holes than a hooker's fishnets.
Fell into a Whirligig and got spun into fucking oblivion. Not even a proper body left to loot.
Impaled on some freaky shit. Looks like he hugged a tree made of knives.
Head popped like a zit under a controller's stare. Messy way to go.
Face mauled off by a pack of blind dogs. Poor fucker didn't see it coming. Literally.
Radiation poisoning. Vomited his guts out before his teeth started falling. Zone-style dental plan.
Body looks like a pincushion, full of anomaly spikes. This zone's a real motherfucker.
Trapped in a Gas anomaly. Suffocated on his own lungs turning to mush. Shitty way to die.
Found him half inside a rock. Fucking Teleport anomaly played ping-pong with him.
Died drinking. Not alcohol, but a toxic sludge from a chemical pit. Fucking idiot.
Torn apart by a Pseudogiant. Got stomped into the mud like a cigarette butt.
Looks like he tried to fuck with a Chimera. Bad choice. Now he's zone chow.
Froze to death. Caught in a Cryogenic anomaly. At least he went out stiff.
Blown up by his own grenade. Moron forgot to throw it.
Heart gave out - scared shitless by something. Died a coward, or just unlucky as fuck.
Skull split wide open, brains decorating the fucking ground. Guess a Snork wanted to see what thoughts looked like.
Body charred to hell and back. If there's anything left of his soul, it's floating way above this godforsaken shithole.
Bludgeoned to death with his own rifle. Irony's a bitch in the Zone.
Looks like his insides decided they wanted a better view of the Zone. Gutted by a Bloodsuckers claws.
Drowned in a puddle of his own blood. Must've been a quiet, fucked up way to go.
Slaughtered by a pack of mutants. They shredded him like he was a piece of meat in a grinder.
Sliced clean in half by a sharp anomaly. Left wondering whether the top or bottom half hit the ground first.
Looks like the Zone chewed him up and spat him out. Bodys a twisted wreck.
Mauled by something unspeakably foul. Only bones and tattered rags left.
Caught a faceful of acid from a Burer. Features melted off as nicely as wax on a birthday cake.
Electrocuted till his eyes popped out. Must've light up the night sky like a fucked-up Christmas tree.
Impaled by a dozen spikes. Looked like a goddamn human hedgehog by the end.
Fucked by a Vortex. Spun his guts up like a carnival ride from hell.
Looks like he kissed a grenade. A closed-casket funeral kind of kiss.
Corpse fried to a crisp. Walked into an Electro anomaly like a total dipshit.
Burnt to nothing but ash and bones. Guess the Zone was done barbecuing his ass.
Throat torn out by a Bloodsucker. Died gurgling his own blood in a dark, cold shithole.
Fell from a cliff. Or was pushed. Either way, ended up a pile of broken limbs and agony.
Frozen solid in a Cryogenic anomaly. A grim fucking ice sculpture marking his grave.
Decapitated by a flying piece of rebar. His head did more traveling than he did.
Crushed by a fucking building, of all things. The Zone doesn't play favorites.
Face chewed off by dogs. What a shitty way to go. Not much for an open-casket.
Found him splattered across a rock. Gravity's a bitch in the Zone.
Shot in the back, the coward's way. Left to die in a piss-soaked ditch.
Looks like a pack of wild boars turned him into a plaything. They ripped him a new one, literally.
His head's gone. Something blew it clean off. Zone-style justice.
Body's all kinds of fucked up. Looks like he fell into a grinder.
Torso found 20 meters from the rest. Whatever hit him, hit him hard.
Looks like he tried to fuck with a Chimera and lost. Badly.
Found dead, hugging a grenade like it was his lover. The Zone's a lonely place.
Strangled with his own intestines. Whatever did this was sending a message.
Died screaming, cooked inside his suit by an anomaly. A human stew.
Neck snapped by a fucking poltergeist. Turned his head around like a bottle cap.
Caught in a bloodsucker's bear hug. Crushed ribs and a sucked-dry corpse were all that was left.
Incinerated by a sudden blast. Only his charred boots remained, still smoking.
Gutted like a fish. Whatever killed him had claws sharp as razors and no fucking mercy.
His corpse was twitching with electric shocks when we found him. Death by Electro, the twitchy bitch.
Eaten alive by rats. A slow, painful, and fucked up way to die.
Found half inside an anomaly, half out. The Zone's version of a magic trick gone wrong.
Skull hollowed out. Looks like the brain-suckers had a feast. Creepy shit.
Fucking eviscerated. Guts spread out like a gruesome feast.
Blown to bits by a mine. Found pieces of him up in the treeslike some sick fucking Christmas decorations.
Caught in a bear trap. Bled out like a stuck pig screaming all the way to hell.
Crushed by a falling tree. What a fucked-up way to go, even for the Zone.
Throat slit. Whoever did this was pissed off at him; the cut was deep and messy.
Mauled by something big, fast, and invisible. His bones were scattered like a kid's toy blocks.
Looks like he played tag with a grenade. The grenade won. What's left could fit in a soup can.
Riddled with bullets. They turned him into a bloody sieve right on the spot.
Sliced up by anomaly blades. Left him in ribbons, fluttering in the breeze.
Chewed up by a pack of blind dogs. They didn't leave much behind, just bones and a blood stain.
Found dead, his body twisted in impossible angles. The Zone's physics dont play by the rules.
Skull crushed by a mutant's fist. His brains were smeared all over the fucking place.
Decapitated by a flying piece of metal. The Zone's own version of a guillotine.
Electrocuted. Found him clinging to a fence, fried to a crisp. Smelled like barbecue.
Drowned in a bog. Sank right down into the muck. Only found because his hand was sticking out.
Face ripped off by a bloodsucker. His expression frozen in a scream; its the shit of nightmares.
Corpse booby-trapped by some sadistic fuck. Took out two of our guys. The Zones full of surprises.
Burned alive in a fire anomaly. His body was charred black, frozen in a dance of death.
Ripped apart by a Chimera. His parts were strewn over half a kilometer. Nasty way to go.
Caught in the crossfire of a faction war. Bullet holes stitched across his chest like a fucking sash.
Impaled on a steel beam. Probably got launched by an explosion or an anomaly.
Ground him up. Nothing left but a fine red mist and shredded gear.
Torn to shreds. It was a frenzy of claws and teeth, likely a mutant pack attack.
Head caved in by a Burer's telekinetic slam. Blood and brain splattered everywhere.
Choked on toxic fumes. His last breaths were hell on Earth.
Fell into a spike trap. Punctured in so many places he looked like a pincushion.
Slashed apart by a mutant with claws like scythes. Pieces of him spread far and wide.
Face melted off by a chemical anomaly. Left looking like a Halloween mask gone wrong.
Turned into a pile of bones and ash by a Burner anomaly. Nothing recognizable left.
Psy-dog messed with his mind until he tore out his own eyes. Died blind and insane.
Blasted to bits by a Claymore. Who the fuck left that there?
Eyes gouged out and skull bashed in. Some vicious bastard did this up close and personal.
Squished flat by a pseudogiant. Left a nasty smear on the ground.
Burnt to a crisp by a flash anomaly. His body is like charcoal, ready to crumble.
Legs shattered, likely fell from a great height. The Zone's a tough place for high climbers.
Torn in half by a Whirligig anomaly. One part here, the other part there.
Choked to death on some unknown substance. Whatever it was, it wasn't natural.
Completely dismembered by a pseudogiant. Turned him into a jigsaw puzzle with no solution.
Stabbed multiple times by something sharp and unforgiving. No chance of survival.
Bitten by something venomous. Died foaming at the mouth, eyes bulging.
Body crushed by a falling anomaly. Found him flattened like a pancake.
Torn apart by a pack of rabid pseudodogs. Only bloody rags and bones left.
Bludgeoned to death with his own weapon. Irony isn't lost in the Zone.
Entrails strewn across the ground, probably a mutant's meal.
Death by spontaneous combustion. Nothing left but a scorch mark.
Blown apart by an explosive trap. Shrapnel turned him into Swiss cheese.
Dragged away by something large and fast. Blood trail stops abruptly.
Drowned in his own blood. Took a lungful and that was it.
Skewered by a sharp metal rod, likely thrown by an explosion.
Skin peeled off by something corrosive. Found him looking like a raw piece of meat.
Neck twisted around. Likely a controller got him, poor bastard.
Heart attack brought on by pure terror. His face frozen in a rictus of fear.
Mutant bite to the neck. Bled out in seconds, couldn't even scream.
Face first into a Whirligig. Blood and guts sprayed everywhere.
Something ripped his heart out. The body was a mess, but no heart anywhere.
Found him charred to the bone. Zone's a hell of a place to get a tan.
Choked on his own vomit. Must've ingested something nasty.
Looks like a mutant clawed his eyes out. Died screaming in the dark.
Found pinned to a wall by a steel beam. Strong wind or just bad luck?
Bloodsucker took his head clean off. Found the body, but no head.
Shotgun blast to the chest. Internal organs liquefied. Nasty way to go.
Mutants ripped his guts out. Body found half-buried in the dirt.
Crushed by a falling tree. Slow, painful, and silent.
Electrocuted by an anomaly. Fried to a crisp, eyes bulging out of his skull.
Burned alive in a chemical fire. Skin melted right off the bone.
Found with his head caved in. Likely attacked by a Burer.
Massive blood loss from a mutant attack. Body drained dry.
Shot in the back while running. No honor in that kind of death.
Died from infection. Wounds left untreated too long. Zones unforgiving that way.
Found dangling from a tree. Suicide, or did something string him up?
Skull smashed in, brains everywhere. Guess he got too close to a mutant.
Impaled on rebar, chest punctured. Hung like a morbid decoration.
Slashed to ribbons by an anomaly. Blood trails lead nowhere.
Face frozen in terror. No visible wounds. Something scared him to death.
Found in a pool of blood, his own hands ripped off. The look of horror on his face was something else.
Body twisted in impossible angles, like a puppet with its strings cut. Something played with him before he died.
Found staring at his own reflection in a pool of black water. Heart stopped cold.
Skin turned inside out. The stench of burnt flesh still lingers.
Found whispering to a corpse, his throat slit from ear to ear.
Eyes gouged out and filled with dirt. A makeshift grave by some sick fuck.
Clawed at his own face until it was unrecognizable. Whatever he saw must have been horrifying.
Found hanging from the ceiling, entrails draped like Christmas decorations. The Zone's festive touch.
Eyes wide open, mouth stretched in a silent scream. No signs of struggle, just pure fear.
Dragged through the mud, fingernails torn off trying to hold on. The tracks just end abruptly.
Carved up like a turkey, organs neatly arranged around him. A twisted feast for some demented creature.
Found in a dark corner, whispering "It's coming" until his last breath.
Eyes removed and replaced with polished stones. A collectors gruesome art piece.
Burned to a crisp but still clutching a note saying "It burns inside me."
Found standing upright, frozen in fear. Eyes fixed on something we couldn't see.
Ripped in half, each part miles apart. Something fast, something vicious did this.
Blood smeared on the walls spelling "Help me." His hands were raw and bloody.
Flesh torn from his bones, not by claws, but by fingers. Human or not, something wanted him dead.
Head twisted all the way around, body found kneeling in a prayer pose. No mercy in the Zone.
Eyes melted out of his skull. Found clutching his face, teeth still clenched in agony.
Buried alive. Hands poking through the dirt, fingers reaching for a help that never came.
Skin flayed from his body and hung like a grim flag. The Zone's message to all.
Teeth marks all over his bones. Something chewed him down to nothing.
Crucified on a tree. Body drained of blood, but no sign of a struggle.
Body found stuffed inside a barrel, limbs twisted to fit. The smell was unforgettable.
Head missing, spine ripped out. Whatever did this had monstrous strength.
Heart removed with surgical precision. The Zone has its own twisted surgeons.
Skin turned to stone, body contorted in agony. Must have touched a cursed artifact.
Eyes burnt out, body untouched. The Zone's light is deadly.
Hung from a tree, but no marks on the neck. Suspended by something invisible.
Brain turned to mush, but no visible wounds. Psy-field exposure?
Eyes turned black, skin pale as death. Radiation poisoning or something worse?
Body parts arranged in a circle, entrails spread out like a ritual. The Zones cults at work.
Frozen in a block of ice in the middle of the Zone. A cruel twist of nature.
Skin peeled off and arranged like a tapestry. The Zone's art is macabre.
Body torn apart, pieces hanging from branches. The forest has eyes and claws.
Found floating in mid-air, as if caught in a freeze-frame of terror. The Zone defies gravity.
Heart missing, chest cavity intact. Something took it clean out.
Skeleton found in perfect condition, flesh stripped clean. The Zone's scavengers leave nothing behind.
Brain turned to ash inside the skull. A psy-emission's deadly touch.
Body twisted into a knot, bones shattered. Whatever did this, it wasnt human.
Eyes replaced with glowing stones, skin etched with strange symbols. The Zones magic is dark and cruel.
Hands missing, mouth stuffed with dirt. An execution or a grim message?
Found upside down, suspended by the ankles. Blood pooled on the ceiling, defying all logic.
Body desiccated, skin like parchment. A slow, agonizing death in the Zone's grasp.
Heart stopped, body unmarked. Fear alone can kill in the Zone.
Hands clutching his own throat, face frozen in a final, desperate plea for air.
Body torn in half, entrails trailing behind. Something massive did this.
Skin turned to glass, shattered at the slightest touch. The Zones touch is fragile and fatal.
Eyes missing, sockets filled with blood. A warning to others?
Ritual markings carved into his flesh. The Zone's cults are getting bolder.
Found in a perfect circle of burnt grass. Something supernatural is at play here.
Eyes wide open, heart stopped. Saw something so horrifying, it killed him on the spot.
Dragged through the dirt, fingers clawing at the ground. The Zone doesnt let go easily.
Skeletonized in hours, something in the Zone devours flesh rapidly.
Left hanging upside down from a tree, throat slit. A message to the rest of us.
Burned from the inside out, his skin blackened and cracked. A slow, painful death.
Body hollowed out, organs missing. The Zones creatures are thorough.
Eyes gouged out, skin pale and clammy. The Zones horrors go beyond the physical.
Ripped to shreds, his remains scattered in a wide radius. Something big and angry did this.
Found with a look of sheer terror, no visible wounds. Died of fear.
Skinned alive, body left as a warning. The Zone's residents play for keeps.
Body twisted and mangled, left in a grotesque pose. The Zone warps everything, even death.
Half-buried in the ground, face down. Scratches on the surface show he tried to claw his way out.
Eyes melted out, body untouched. The Zones invisible dangers are the worst.
Heart torn out, chest cavity empty. Whatever did this, did it with surgical precision.
Found wrapped in barbed wire, cuts deep into his flesh. Struggled till his last breath.
Body hollow, bones removed. Something in the Zone collects its victims piece by piece.
Frozen solid, standing upright. A chilling end in the Zones cold embrace.
Eyes and tongue missing, but no other marks. The Zones cruelty is unpredictable.
Limbs torn off, torso untouched. Left to bleed out in the Zones merciless landscape.
Burnt alive, body charred black. The smell of burnt flesh still lingers in the air.
Impaled on a tree branch, blood dripping down like rain. A cruel end in the Zones forests.
Eyes wide open, heart stopped. Fear killed him before anything else could.
Found with no visible wounds, but dead all the same. The Zones mysteries claim another victim.
Body frozen in a scream, eyes staring at something unseen. The Zones horrors are unending.
Skinned alive, hung from a tree. A message to all who dare enter the Zone.
Face missing, eyes gouged out. The Zone leaves nothing untouched.
Head twisted backwards, eyes staring at his own spine. The Zones brutality knows no bounds.
Heart missing, chest cavity empty. The Zones creatures are precise in their cruelty.
Body found in pieces, scattered like a jigsaw puzzle. The Zones dangers are relentless.
Burnt to a crisp, body blackened and cracked. The Zones fire spares no one.
Skinned alive, body left as a grim warning. The Zones message is clear.
Head missing, body untouched. The Zones cruelty is unending.
Eyes removed, skin pale and clammy. The Zones horrors go beyond the physical.
Burnt from the inside out, skin blackened and cracked. A slow, painful death.
Body hollowed out, organs missing. The Zones creatures leave nothing behind.
Eyes gouged out, skin pale and clammy. The Zones horrors are unimaginable.
Ripped to shreds, remains scattered far and wide. The Zones brutality is unmatched.
Found with a look of sheer terror, no visible wounds. The Zones fear is palpable.
Skinned alive, body twisted in agony. The Zones cruelty knows no limits.
Body twisted and mangled, left in a grotesque pose. The Zone warps everything, even death.
Half-buried in the ground, face down. Scratches on the surface show he tried to claw his way out.
Eyes melted out, body untouched. The Zones invisible dangers are the worst.
Heart torn out, chest cavity empty. Whatever did this, did it with surgical precision.
Wrapped in barbed wire, cuts deep into his flesh. Struggled till his last breath.
Body hollow, bones removed. Something in the Zone collects its victims piece by piece.
Frozen solid, standing upright. A chilling end in the Zones cold embrace.
Eyes and tongue missing, but no other marks. The Zones cruelty is unpredictable.
Limbs torn off, torso untouched. Left to bleed out in the Zones merciless landscape.
Burned alive, body charred black. The smell of burnt flesh still lingers in the air.
Damn, it's really dark now isn't it? Stay close to your camp.
Well, fuck. I'm on guard duty this night.
Everyone stay in your camps.
Screw you and your hunting! At night. Hunting snorks... Fucking psychopaths.
Beautiful night...
Yeah, go ahead, hunting down bloodsuckers in the middle of the night like a bunch of dumbasses.
The moon is gonna be up before long. Damn, I feel something is creeping nearby...
Shit! I can barely see the road...
I heard that chimeras only appear at night... is that true?
No, I'm not going anywhere. It's too late...
Well, pussies, time to start shaking.
Is it supposed to be that dark?
I keep hearing sudden sloshing in the dark. It's better to wander somewhere else...
Tonight, mutant activity here is up to eleven, and, well... so is everywhere else, so everybody, stay in your camps!
I heard that burers come to the surface at night... It's better to catch some sleep in the camp.
These roads are no longer safe.
Okay, return to your camps slowly. The Zone is absolutely not safe at night!
Shit. Guys, do what you want, but I'm not going to look for loot today. Night is coming...
Damn, the sun's already going down... I can already feel something unsettling in the vicinity.
The night is for the bold. No more tourist shit - the night Zone is the real Zone.
I heard that Military Stalkers operate at night - not the kind of people you want to run into.
Shit, did you hear that? I have no idea what the fuck that was.
Is there supposed to be someone outside the perimeter? I swear there's someone out there...
Don't be a moron: just check on it in the morning. God only knows what's out there right now.
Don't go messing around in the dark. So many people go out into the night and disappear.
There's a bad moon rising.
Good night. Good luck.
Whispers in the wind tonight. They say it's the voices of those who didn't make it. Stay sharp, stay safe.
Darkness isn't empty here, it's alive. If you listen close, you can hear it breathing, waiting. Don't stray far.
The glow from the anomalies looks like ghost lights. Lost two friends chasing them. It's not treasure, it's a trap.
Nothing good comes from the night air. Smells like metal and blood. If you smell it, lock down and lights out.
Never look directly at the shadows. Saw a guy once who did; he's not been right since. Says they looked back.
Someone's been turning off the path lights near the swamp. If it's you, stop. It's not funny, it's deadly.
Heard the howl of a bloodsucker close by. This is no night for heroes. Double-check those barricades.
The stars are gone tonight. When the sky's this dark, the Zone gets hungry. Don't wander off.
Radio's been static all night. It's like the Zone is holding its breath. When it exhales, I don't wanna be out here.
Got a glimpse of something in the dark, thought it was my mind playing tricks. Turns out, some tricks bite back.
They say the night's alive, and I believe it. Walked past a tree that wasn't there yesterday. It screamed when I touched it.
Last night, the moon turned red, and the mutants got quiettoo quiet. It's never a good sign when the predators hush.
Flashlights don't always help. Sometimes, they make it worse. Saw something run away when I turned mine on; wish I hadn't seen it at all.
Creepers in the mist tonight. You can hear them shuffle, but never see them. Keep your lights close and your firearm closer.
Laughing in the dark isnt always joyous. Heard it once near the old mill. Nothing's been right since. Avoid it after dusk.
My light flickered and in that moment of darkness, I saw eyes reflecting back at me. No blinking, just staring. Always have spare batteries.
The night's thick with fog, and every light just blurs out. Heard my name called out from the haze. No one was there.
Tonight, the echo of footsteps follows me, but no one's there when I look back. It's getting closer every night.
Marks on the camp's edge; not human, not mutant. Something else is here with us. Watch your backs.
The night watches us as much as we watch it. Feel those eyes on you? Yeah, you're not alone, nor are you imagining it.
Wind's carrying voices tonight. They say not to listen, that they're the calls of the damned trying to lure you out.
Don't follow the lights. Lost a friend who went chasing what he thought was a guiding star. It led him right into an anomaly.
It's an old stalker's advice: if you feel a sudden chill, run. Something's nearby, and it's not just the cold.
Ever hear the sound of laughter at night? Not the joyful kind, but cold, mocking. It's the Zone laughing at us, mocking our fears. Stay inside.
The darker the night, the closer you feel itthe Zone's heartbeat. Thumping, not under your feet... but inside your head. Don't listen too closely.
That ain't just the wind howling through the trees. It's the cries of those who got lost to the dark. They're part of it now, and they're hungry.
Keep your fire burning bright tonight. Shadows like to creep close when it's flickering. And when it goes out... well, pray it doesn't.
The moon's too bright tonight, makes the shadows deeper, darker, where things better not seen are stirring. Best keep your gaze low and your gun ready.
Watch the stars. If they start to move, it's not your eyes playing tricks. It's something ancient waking up, and you don't want to be there when it fully does.
Some nights, the air feels thicker, tastes like metal. That's when you know something's coming. Close up shop, bar the door, and ignore any knocks.
Heard a whispering in the grass last night. Thought it was just the wind. This morning, found footprints all around my tent. Nothing human could make those.
If the ground starts to rumble, don't run; freeze. Most things hunting in the dark are excited by movement. If you're still, you might just live.
There's a chill in the air tonight that seeps into your bones. That's the kind of cold that clings; it's not the weatherit's a warning.
Night's not the time for heroics. It's the time for silence and survival. Talk too loud, and you'll find out why the silence is better.
Got a tip from an old-timer: never look an anomaly directly in the eye at night. It sees that as a challenge, and it will not back down.
Every night, the Zone changes. Paths that were clear by day are traps by night. Trust your map less than your instincts.
Avoid the old railway station after dusk. The trains you hear aren't echoes from the past; they're something else, something hungry for more than just coal.
Sometimes the ground feels soft underfoot, like it's breathing. That's when you stop, reassess, because you might be walking over something that isn't ground at all.
The night sky isn't just starsit's eyes. Watch for when they blink, because that's when you know they've noticed you.
Do you ever hear your name being called from the trees? It's not your mind playing tricks. It's them, the lost ones. Don't answer. Keep walking.
When it's too quiet, be afraid. The Zone is never silent unless it's about to scream. And you don't want to be there when it does.
It's during moments like this in the morning that I remember my childhood. My village. You get up so early and watch the shadow and light play in your room... It's unreal. Magical.
Almost like evening...
Bricks were shat all night at the camp. Terrible night!
Fucking burers had a yell fest yesterday. Or... were they fractures?
Can anyone hear me? A group of our guys went missing tonight. Should have been back by the morning. Still nothing. We'll go looking for them soon. Join us.
Guys, you should see what a dawn is on Yantar. This surely is something... scary, and beautiful... Snork corpses drifting in the sparkling surface of the lake in the morning sun, so cool... Romantic...
Guys, wake up! It's morning already!
Guys, it's dawning... It's so beautiful.
Rise and shine, folks. I'm pretty sure we can get moving already, there's not much we could run into. Not like at night.
Finally, the sky is no longer black. I can move with the damn wildlife gone.
It's morning. Moving forward, it's more or less safe now.
A beautiful dawn! As if it were Sevastopol, not the Zone!
Day is breaking...
Egh... I used to have completely different things to do in the morning.
Time to be standing up again, geez.
A terror, not a morning.
Is it morning already? Finally.
Damn, who invented morning?... We've been drinking all night...
Even in this place, beauty exists!
Hey, guys! Finally, dawn has come. I'm tired of shaking in fear in the dark. Better to shiver in the light of day...
Bad night, almost no sleep. Shit, I've things to do...
Nothing like a good restful sleep to take on the Zone. Feelin good!
Hopefully the sun will force some of those freaks back into their holes.
Don't be deceived: you can get killed just as easily in the morning. Keep sharp.
Time to go take a look, let's see how the day's shaping up.
Anyone know where to find coffee? I would kill for some of that right now.
Have a smoke and watch the Zone wake up... dangerous but beautiful.
Any changes since last night? I heard something moving out there, couldn't say what.
Morning over Chernobyl, the reactor funnel gleaming in the sunlight... the darkness has retreated underground.
Who in the fuck stole my detector? I'm going to find you, you little shit!
Another day for you and me in paradise.
Let there be light.
Good morning, brothers.
Morning, you bunch of bastards.
The first light creeps over the horizon, a reminder that the Zone doesn't sleep and neither should we.
With the dawn comes a faint hope, like finding a bullet in the dust. Time to move, brothers.
The suns up. The shadows still hold threats, but at least you can see whats trying to kill you now.
Dawn breaks, and so does the silence. The Zone is never truly quiet, is it?
Mornings are for regrets: the missed shots, the lost friends. But also for fresh starts. Sort of.
Sunrise. Maybe today we find what were here for. Maybe today we dont die trying.
New morning, same old dangers. Watch your back as the light plays tricks.
Wake up, Stalkers! The Zone offers us a new day to make our old mistakes.
The sun rises timidly, as if scared of what it might reveal in the Zone.
Morning comes whether you're ready or not. The Zone waits for no one.
Early light showers the Zone, casting long shadows and longer doubts.
As the dawn colors the skies, remember: every sunrise here could be your last. Cherish it.
The eerie calm of morning in the Zone. Its too quiet. Always a bad sign.
Good morning? Its just morning. Good is a stretch in the Zone.
Another day of survival begins at dawn. The Zone doesnt care if youre not ready.
Look at that sunrise, almost makes you forget where we are. Almost.
Dawn's light pierces through the mist. Even the air you breathe is a threat here.
The crack of dawn, better get moving before the anomalies reset. Its a maze every day.
Another morning, another chance to dodge death... or embrace it. Thats the Zones gamble.
Morning sweeps across the Zone, a faint whisper of life amidst the desolation.
The sun rises, as indifferent to us as the Zone itself. Survival doesnt depend on daylight.
At dawn, even the Zone seems serene. Don't let it fool you; it's just catching its breath.
Morning in the Zone: when the grey of night meets the grey of day. Keep your eyes peeled.
Daylight creeps in slowly here, like its afraid of what it might see.
Each new morning in the Zone is a miracle and a curse. You survived another night; now survive the day.
Good morning? Let's not pretend. It's just morning. The 'good' part is up to us to make happen.
Morning light, a stalkers first friend and last enemy. It reveals us to both prey and predator.
As the dawn breaks, remember that every shadow in the Zone has teeth.
The first rays of sun signal another day of survival. Don't waste the light.
A new dawn, a new day, and Im still breathing. Thats something, right?
The morning sun rises, reluctant and pale, as if scared to illuminate too much of this cursed land.
Boring day.
It's gonna be a long day, isn't it?
The day hasn't ended yet and I feel tired already...
Gotta finish my contract today, won't wait till night hits the Zone.
I got many contracts to finish today, accepting all this shit at once was a stupid mistake.
It's gonna be a looooong day guys, I can feel it.
Just for your info, controllers roam the surface in broad daylight. Hope that wakes you up.
Finish your work already, unless you don't mind doing it at night.
I shouldn't have stayed up all night, I feel exhausted.
Boars and fleshes go crazy at this time, don't be a hero and go on a hunting trip alone.
Let's get this shit done while we still can - we can't wait around forever.
Damn it, where did he get to? He was supposed to be here by sunrise.
Maybe it's time to clear out those Flesh packs, eh? They're most active around this time.

I hope we don't meet those creepy things on the way.

I miss my family, and my old friends.

Stay away from psi-fields, I don't want to join those zombies.

You see those rookies? Lets scare the piss out of 'em. Good for a laugh, good for their gear.
Listen up, $name. Its a shit world, and were here to stir it up. Dont get sentimental on me now.
The only rule in the Zone: there are no fuckin' rules. Remember that next time you feel like playing nice.
We ain't here to make friends, we're here to make bank. Screw anyone who gets in our way.
Don't look at me like that, $name. I'm not your mother. Let's just get this job done.
Get your head out of your ass and your gun in your hand. Were not on a fuckin' picnic here.
Keep up or get left behind. The Zone doesn't care about your feelings, and neither do I.
You're not dead yet, so I guess you're doing something right. Keep it up and we might just survive this shitstorm.
Alright, enough chit-chat. Time to fuck shit up and get paid. You in, $name, or are you gonna cry about it?
Hey $name, see that stalker over there? He's about to have a real bad day. Let's make sure of it.
This aint no place for the weak. Harden the fuck up, or youll be the Zones next meal.
You think this is a game? This is survival, $name. Only the toughest bastards make it. Be one, or be dead.
Lets cut the crap, $name. Were here to fuck everyone else over before they do the same to us. Capiche?
This Zone's a shithole, but its our shithole. Anyone tries to cut in on our turf gets a bullet in the skull.
Fuck the rules! We make our own rules out here. First rule: take what you can, kill anyone who stands in your way.
See that loner? I bet hes got gear up the ass. Lets go roll him for everything hes fucking got.
Heads up, $name. Its every shithead for themselves around here. Dont expect any fucking mercy.
I'm not your buddy, I'm not your friend. I'm the motherfucker that's gonna save your ass when shit hits the fanif you're lucky.
Keep your eyes peeled and your finger on the trigger. Were not dying today, not for some other bastards mistake.
Who gives a fuck about tomorrow? We live today, we drink tonight, and we loot everything in sight.
Quit your whining. The Zone ain't a place for babies. It's a place to get rich or die trying.
This piss-poor weather's perfect for some sneaky shit. Let's find some prick to rob blind.
Hey, you see that stash? Fuck guarding it, let's take it all and drink till we can't see straight.
You think these mutants are bad? You should see the fucks I deal with daily. At least the mutants dont backstab.
That fucker thinks he can double-cross us? I'll shove a grenade up his ass and see how tough he is then.
Stay sharp, $name. This ain't no charity run. We're here to steal, kill, and survive.
Let's get this straight, I'm not here to hold your hand. I'm here to watch my own ass, and maybe yours if it gets me something.
Zones taught me one thingtrust's for the weak. You watch my back, I'll stab yours if I need to.
Life's cheap in the Zone, $name. Remember that. Its cheaper when you're staring down the barrel of my gun.
This storms a blessing. Perfect for washing away the blood of those fuckers we took down.
You feel that? The thrill of the hunt, the rush of the kill. That's what living really is, $name.
Stay sharp, soldier.
I have orders to shoot bandits on sight.
Don't allow intruders to wander around, we must prevent stalkers from passing through.
We got medical supplies from the HQ yesterday, I need to resupply later.
Talk to the commander if you're looking for a job, he might accept your assistance in a few cases.
Being a soldier isn't an easy job, especially in a place like the Zone.
Shit... I forgot my lighter.
We need to get rid of those Freedomers forever.
And I thought maneuvers were bad.
You can't relax in this place - you just can't.
Heard one of our choppers was shot down yesterday.
What I wouldn't give for some armor support!
Keep an eye out for any canned goods - rations have been pretty thin.
We should really be moving around in force; I'm sick of seeing our men get taken apart piecemeal.
Another asshole promoted to lieutenant... the good ones usually get killed.
Hear about that corporal that got court-marshaled for trading with the stalkers?
You got much ammo? We've had a shortage recently.
Ever see Kuznetsov's secret whiskey supply? I hear he gets drunk every night.
A whole squad got caught out in the open when one of those emissions hit. Let's be smart about this.
Every single guy in my original unit has been killed. I'm starting to think I'm bad luck.
Literally any other assignment sounds pretty good after this shithole.
Those reinforcements finally got here: fancy new uniforms and shiny boots and all that. They're in for a surprise.
You should keep a bandage in your radio-pouch: you don't want to be digging around in your bag with blood pouring out of you.
Why does it always feel like we're outnumbered here? What the hell is that about?
Watch for that burning moss shit. All sorts of things they don't mention in training...
I envy those boys that get to sit on their ass guarding the perimeter.
This is not what I signed up for. Well fine, I was conscripted.
I heard Spooner gets some of his supplies from the stalkers.
Some of these lunatics in here will shoot you on sight. And some people wonder why we return the favor.
Another month of this... I'll be happy if I get out of this place with my limbs intact.
You would think our pay would be better for what we put up with.
How long you been stationed here, $name?
Man, I miss Spirit's cooking. He could fry up a great omelet.
Think they gave me some dead guy's uniform. Gives me the creeps.
You know, I was the top marksman in my unit. Stuff like that will save your life out here.
Soldier's life, right? So romantic. Always crowded around by adoring girls. Medals and awards from every side.
At least I'm not on the night patrol. Those are some crazy bastards.
Some private went AWOL last week. I heard he's been seen with those bandits now.
We should just carpet-bomb this entire place.
Ever see those one military stalkers? Very hush-hush. More like stalkers than soldiers, I think.
Look sharp. Could be enemies anywhere.
Weapons check. Everyone locked and loaded?.
This is my second tour here. I hope I get to go home soon.
Can't believe I signed up for this shit.
Join the military, they said. See the world, they said.
I swear, the coffee here tastes like it's filtered through an old boot. Miss the mess hall back home.
Were not just fighting the Zone; were fighting to keep our sanity here. Stay focused.
Got a smoke? I'd kill for a real cigarette about now, not these local hand-rolled disasters.
If you see any of those bandit fucks, shoot first. We'll sort it out later.
Every time it rains, it feels like the sky's trying to clean the filth off this forsaken place.
Remember, maintain your gear, or it'll fail when you need it most. That goes for you too, $name.
Watch where you step. Anomalies aren't the only things that can kill you out here.
Last night's patrol was a shitshow. Lost a good man to a damn snipe. Eyes open, alright?
Nothing beats a warm meal, a cold drink, and a dry pair of boots. Too bad we're fresh out of all three.
If this place doesnt kill you, the boredom will. Let's go find something to shoot at.
Don't bother digging trenches. If the mutants dont get you, the anomalies will.
Sometimes I think the monsters out there are just here to distract us from the real horrors of this place.
The only good mutant is a dead one. Keep your finger ready on that trigger.
Let's not end up like those Freedom idiots, thinking they can make friends with the Zone.
This zone will test you in ways you never expected. Don't fold under the pressure.
Mark my words, $name, no one leaves the Zone unchanged. Watch yourself out here.
You ever miss home? Yeah, me too... but this is our life now. Best make the most of it.
We might be soldiers, but out here, we're survivors first and foremost.
I used to complain about drills back at the base. Now? I'd give anything for that kind of normal day.
This damned place... It's like being stuck between the hammer and the anvil.
Sometimes I wonder what we're even doing here. Then I remember: we don't have a choice.
You think it ever gets easier? Guess again. It only gets harder. But we'll get through it. Together.
Stick with me, and keep your head down. We'll make it through, or die trying.
Check your gear and stay alert. The enemy isnt always going to come from outside the wire.
You learn to appreciate the little things in life when death is staring you in the face every day.
Rations might be shit, but it's better than eating what those bandits scrounge up.
Remember: shoot first, ask questions later. It's not just policy; it's survival.
You hear those howls last night? Keep your weapon handythings are getting restless.
I'd tell you to write home if I thought it'd make a difference. Out here, we're on our own.
Keep your boots tight and your kit in order. You dont want to find out youre missing something when you need it most.
This place makes the front lines look like a playground. Stay alert, $name.
They say war never changes, but they've never been to the Zone. Here, you never know what's coming next.
That emission last week? Took out half our gear. Check your electronics, don't get caught off guard.
Lost another good man to the anomalies. This place doesn't discriminate; it'll kill you all the same.
Ever think about what youll do if you make it out? Me, I stopped planning for the future a long time ago.
Out here, your gun is your best friend. Keep it clean and it'll save your life.
Nothing quite like a hot meal to make you forget about the death lurking around every corner, even if just for a moment.
The next patrol could be our last. I'm not trying to scare you, just preparing you for the reality of the Zone.
A quiet night's a rare gift here. Don't waste it; rest while you can.
This isn't the kind of place where you grow old. Keep that in mind every time you lace up your boots.
You smell that? That's the smell of fear, sweat, and radiation. Welcome to the Zone, rookie.
Dont let the calm fool you. Its just the storm taking a breath. Stay ready.
Our orders are simple: hold the line, secure the Zone. Doesn't get much cleareror much harderthan that.
That stash of ammo we found? Turns out it was a decoy. Nearly got us killed. Trust nothing.
Sometimes I miss the noise of the city. Out here, the silence can drive you mad.
Its not the dead you should fear, but the living. Especially in the Zone.
When we're done here, the first thing I'm doing is taking a long, hot shower. Might never feel clean again, though.
They say theres gold in the Zone. Not the kind you can spend, but the kind that can make you rich... or dead.
If you want to survive, learn to trust your instincts. Sometimes, thats all weve got.
Every patrol is a dice roll. Today, we rolled snake eyes. Let's hope tomorrow brings better odds.
Those fancy new recruits think they know fear? Wait till they've seen what lurks in the dark here.
Keep the chatter to a minimum. Sound carries far at night, especially when death is listening.
We're all just waiting for our ticket out of here. Problem is, it might just be in a body bag.
When the going gets tough, the tough get going. Or they die in the Zone. Your choice, $name.
Remember, kid, courage is not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. Let's show the Zone what we're made of.
Cold was offering some jobs, you may want to check them out later.
The old team has screwed up, but we will get our full strength back in no time.
Be careful, bandits may show up at any moment.
Ever wondered what happened to Lebedev and the rest of his troops after the big emission? Cold says they died, but I heard someone say they became Monolith soldiers... \nCome to think of it, it's very possible that they're still alive.
I think I caught a frog in my ass. Staying at the swamps all the time isn't that healthy.
The Ecologists in Yantar supplied us with new detectors and other equipment, this will help our cause.
I prefer to stay away from military checkpoints, they don't go easy on anyone these days.
Many stalkers joined our side as of late, this is good news.
Latest readings showed that emissions are getting stronger as time passes by, what is the Zone up to?
Psi-storms usually don't participate in artefact creation, massive blowouts on the other hand are a different story.
What happened to the old team was unfortunate.
Be cautious and plan out all your movements. To survive, you have to be thinking all the time.
Researchers want more intact biological specimens... I'd like to see them delicately put down a charging boar.
Airborne radiation has been going down recently, but I've heard that the water is getting worse.
We're getting pushed back all the time; seems like everyone's out to get us.
Spore has been needing more help recently with research expeditions.
Make sure to scavenge as much ammo as you can find - we're usually pretty low.
We got a new volunteer from the ecologists the other day; he managed to snatch some detectors before he defected.
Hit and run is the way to go. We don't have the manpower to throw away soldiers in constant fighting.
We've seen worse. Clear Sky was underground for years after the disaster. We can grow strong again.
Oh damn, I left my LLMC behind.
I hate those dog packs more than anything else. You have to watch your back out there.
I've heard that we came up with a suit that can withstand a Burner anomaly for a full minute. Not with me in it, though.
Monolith seem to have access to multiple Gauss rifles. It's depressing...
Spore is especially on the lookout for psy artefacts right now.
Don't skimp on anomaly protection - you'll never know when it might be necessary.
Don't tell him I said this, but Librarian really can't cook for shit.
I say we should be trying to weaponize Gas clouds and Fruit Punch. We really need an edge these days.
I like the swamps, myself. Not at night, though.
Sometimes we get deserters from the military - the information they bring is invaluable.
I can't remember the last time we had soft-point cartridges. They really did the trick for those mutants.
Novikov's still looking for a design we can use to make standardized weapons out of spare parts. As of now, we're just cobbling together whatever we can get.
If you ever want to hear about the average lifetime projection for a whirligig, Lebedev can drone on for hours - the man's an anomaly encyclopedia.
Glad to get off HQ guard duty.
Just gotta take things one day at a time.
Look out for air distortions - too many find out the hard way.
Ever think about your family, $name? Sometimes I wonder what I'm doing here.
We could always use some new artefacts.
The victory goes to the most intelligent.
You have to know how to survive in the wild - more than that, you need to know how to survive in the Zone. No second chances.
Remember, the swamps are our turf. Keep your sensors sharp and your weapons ready.
Ever watch the fog roll in and wonder if today's the day it'll come alive? This place messes with you.
I've seen things in the Zone that would make a burer blush. Stay on your toes, it's the only way to live through this.
The Zone's not just changing the environment, it's changing us. You feel it too, don't you?
We're the closest thing to scientists some of these stalkers will ever meet. Let's show them why knowledge is power.
If those Duty hardheads had half our brains, they'd be twice as useful out here.
Tracking emissions patterns is like predicting the weather if the weather were out to kill you.
A psi-storm's on the horizon. Make sure you're shielded, unless you fancy a trip to the afterlife.
You know, I've started to see the beauty in the anomalies. It's like nature's way of painting, with a palette of pure chaos.
Clear Sky isn't just a group, it's a belief. We believe we can understand this place, maybe even control it someday.
Keep your gear tight and your mind tighter. Sloppiness leads to death, or worse, around here.
When you're out in the field, remember: every shadow could be hiding a friend or an anomaly. Don't guess - check.
Our fight isn't just with the mutants; it's with the Zone itself. We're trying to peel back its mysteries one layer at a time.
Stay low when the emissions hit. Better to hug the dirt than get swept away to who knows where.
The Zone gives, and the Zone takes. But it seems like it's been doing a lot more taking lately.
Every new artefact is a puzzle piece. Put enough of them together, and maybe we'll see the full picture.
It's not the gunfire that scares meit's the silence that follows.
Our technology might not be military grade, but it's adapted perfectly for the anomalies we deal with daily.
You ever get used to the anomalies? Me neither. Respect them, or they'll show you why you should.
We've had some close calls with blowouts. Makes you appreciate the quiet days... relatively quiet, anyway.
We might not have the firepower of Duty or the anarchy of Freedom, but our knowledge makes us kings here.
Watch the water. It's not just deep, it's deadly. Anomalies aren't picky about where they settle.
Monolith fighters are like ghosts; you don't see them until they're right on top of you. Keep your eyes peeled.
The Zone is alive, I'm convinced of it. Every emission, every anomaly, it's like it's breathing... watching.
I've mapped out potential safe paths through the swamps. Follow me closely, don't deviate.
Remember, the swamps aren't just our home; they're our defense. Know them better than your own pocket.
Stay silent near anomaly fields. Noise can set them off, or worse, attract something that doesn't mind them.
If you're not careful, the Zone will eat you up and spit out your bones. Respect is survival.
You learn to live with the fear here, or you die by it. That's the only choice you get in the Zone.
Sometimes the artifacts seem like a siren's call... beautiful, but deadly. Always use the detector.
The Zone's creatures are a constant reminder: adapt or perish. We choose to adapt.
Clear Sky isn't just fighting for territory; we're fighting for understanding. Every discovery can save lives.
The anomalies today are restless. Could be a sign of another emission. Let's not be here when it hits.
I've seen stalkers go mad out here, talking to the shadows. The Zone doesn't forgive, and it doesn't forget.
Our scouts reported a new type of anomaly formation north of here. We'll need to investigate carefully.
It's not just about surviving the mutants and anomalies; it's about understanding why they're here. That's where we come in.
Keep your guard up. Just because it looks clear, doesn't mean it is. The Zone loves to deceive.
Ever feel like the Zone is testing us? Seeing if we're worthy to uncover its secrets?
We need every edge we can get. Technology, knowledge, instinctthey're all weapons here.
Being here changes a man. You start to see things differently... everything has a price.
When you sleep, keep one eye open. The Zone is full of thieves, and I'm not just talking about the bandits.
Our mission is to understand, but every answer just leads to more questions. That's the curse of Clear Sky.
Don't underestimate the local fauna. Some of these beasts have evolved in ways Darwin never imagined.
We're not here to dominate the Zone; we're here to coexist with it. It's the only way anyone will survive.
The next time we head out, bring extra filters. The air quality seems to be dropping again.
Light doesn't travel far in the Zone. Keep your lamp close and your enemy closer.
There's a rhythm to the Zone. Listen to it, and you might just make it through another day.
Feeling at home yet, $name? Or does the swamp still whisper your fears back to you at night?
We're not just surviving; we're paving the way for others. Our research won't go in vain.
Keep a cool head. Panic kills faster than bullets in the Zone.
Stay sharp, soldier.
If you've found any artefacts, bring them to the commander. The scientists will make good use of them.
If you spotted any bandit scum crossing the line, shoot on sight. The last thing we need is scumbags wandering around.
The guards at our base say that mutant activity has increased as of late, the Zone is getting more dangerous day after day.
I need to have a nice drink at the 100 Rads.
Have you ever considered the Arena? If you're strong and lucky enough, you can earn yourself quite the sum.
I've just heard that the General has sent new troops to the old farm in Army Warehouses. If those clowns even dare trying to stop us, we'll make them pay.
Those stalkers think wandering around our base is a bloody joke.
Be careful, no-one knows what will show up next. The Zone is full of all sorts of creepy things.
We got reinforcements and supplies from the Ukrainian Army a few days ago, the outfits were not bad at all.
Having affairs with bloodsuckers must be fun enough for our bored Freedom friends.
I have orders to shoot Freedom spies on sight, let me know if you spotted one.
No matter how many mutants we put down, more keep coming. How can we hit them at the source?
I think mutants are working alongside the Monolith; I've heard stories of them cooperating.
The Zone is chaos - we have to be discipline.
Don't lose your cool in the fight: moderate your fire and make your shots count.
The General knows what he's doing - Duty's not out of the fight.
AP ammo is like gold - it's essential when you go up against the Monolith.
Lots of real horrors running around these days - I've yet to meet one that likes several well-placed bullets in the brain.
Rostok gets a bit boring, you know. I prefer to be out in the field.
Physical fitness is good, but I think shooting skills are better - few get the chance to punch out a bloodsucker.
Those fucking anarchists shot a good friend of mine last week.
I should have brought more grenades.
I think all army soldiers that give a shit should be joining Duty.
Yanov station belongs to Duty, and were it not for Duty, Loki and all his criminals would have roasted in a blowout.
Mangun's the only soldier I've seen to be more effective when drunk.
It would be nice to hear some thanks from all those loners once in awhile.
I'm so disgusted to hear about corrupt Duty soldiers - it's sickening.
I can imagine Bandits and Freedom agreeing to split the Zone between themselves; they're cut from the same cloth.
Be careful with any artefacts you find: even the scientists don't know much about them.
Wiping out the anarchists will get you more medals, but the whole Zone would be overrun without the mutant exterminators.
Throw a grenade first, and then you right behind it. Get in there before they can recover.
Boars are easy targets from behind, but they can run right over you before you can get a good shot.
When it comes to bloodsuckers, there's nothing quite like a semi-automatic shotgun.
A sober mind is an alert mind.
We all need to take it easy sometimes; I like a good guitar more than anything.
If you walk on two legs, the Zone isn't your friend.
I hope I can rely on you, $name. I'd take one good man over ten punks.
I don't know what we'd do without Colonel Petrenko.
Skill and determination... that's all it is.
Remember, our duty is to protect the people of the Zone, no matter the cost.
Stay vigilant, soldier. The Zone never rests, and neither do we.
Keep your eyes peeled for any signs of Monolith activity. We can't afford to let them gain ground.
Stick close to your squadmates. We're stronger together.
Trust in your training, and trust in your fellow Duty members. We've got each other's backs.
Stay disciplined in your actions. Chaos only benefits our enemies.
Keep your gear in top condition. A malfunctioning weapon could cost you your life.
Report any suspicious activity immediately. We can't afford to be caught off guard.
Remember why we're here. We're fighting to reclaim the Zone from the dangers that threaten it.
Stay focused on the mission, and don't let emotions cloud your judgment.
Watch your step. The Zone is full of hazards, both natural and man-made.
Every Duty member plays a crucial role in our mission. Don't underestimate the importance of your duties.
Be prepared for anything. The Zone is unpredictable, and we must adapt to survive.
Stick to the plan, and execute it flawlessly. Lives depend on it.
Don't let fear control you. We're trained to face the unknown head-on.
Stay in communication with your squadmates. Coordination is key to our success.
Keep your wits about you. The Zone has a way of testing even the most seasoned soldiers.
Trust in the chain of command. Our leaders have seen more of the Zone than any of us.
Stay true to our principles. Duty is more than just a nameit's a way of life.
Hold your ground. We will not retreat in the face of adversity.
Keep your eyes peeled, soldier. This Zone doesn't forgive mistakes.
Forget about the comforts of home, we're out here surviving in the heart of the Zone.
Save the small talk for later. We've got mutants and bandits waiting around every corner.
I've seen rookies like you come and go. Stay sharp, or you won't last long out here.
We're not here for a vacation. Keep your focus on the mission.
Don't get too comfortable. The Zone has a way of reminding you who's in charge.
Save your energy. We've got a long way to go before we can rest.
Watch your back. Trust no one but your fellow soldiers.
Forget about the luxuries of civilization. Out here, it's survival of the fittest.
Keep your weapon ready. The Zone is full of surprises, and most of them aren't pleasant.
Don't let your guard down. In the Zone, complacency will get you killed.
Save your jokes for when we're back at base. Out here, every moment counts.
Enough chatter. We've got a mission to complete, and I don't intend to fail.
Quit reminiscing about the past. Focus on the present, or you'll end up as mutant fodder.
Save your complaints for later. Right now, we need to stay focused on the task at hand.
We're not here for a vacation. This is Duty business, and we've got a job to do.
No time for idle chatter. Stay vigilant, or you'll end up as monster bait.
We're not out here for fun and games. This is a dangerous place, and we need to treat it as such.
Keep your head on a swivel. The Zone is full of threats, and they won't hesitate to take you down.
This isn't a vacation. We're here to do a job, so keep your focus on the mission.
Every moment out here is a test. Stay focused.
Trust in your instincts. They'll keep you alive.
Stick close to your squad. Strength in numbers.
Stay disciplined. Chaos is our enemy.
Maintain your gear. A faulty weapon can cost lives.
Report any suspicious activity immediately. We can't afford surprises.
Remember our mission. We're here to protect the Zone.
Stay focused on the task at hand. Distractions can be deadly.
Watch your step. Danger lurks around every corner.
Every Duty member is crucial. Never underestimate your role.
Prepare for the unexpected. Adapt or perish.
Execute the plan flawlessly. Lives depend on it.
Fear has no place here. Face the unknown head-on.
Coordinate with your squad. Unity is our strength.
Remain vigilant. The Zone is always testing us.
Respect the chain of command. Our leaders know what's best.
Live by our principles. Duty is our way of life.
Stand your ground. We don't retreat.
Stay alert. The Zone never sleeps, and neither do we.
Focus on the present. The past is irrelevant.
I need to replace my detector, it displays incorrect readings sometimes.
I saw one of the scientists holding a Svarog detector in his hands, it was one of the most beautiful things I've seen in a while.
The Professor is looking for certain artefacts, you might want to help him.
I'm writing a dissertation about Electro anomalies, but I need to collect more samples.
The Ukrainian government approved on sending new equipment, I need to get me a decent anomaly detector.
Despite the amount of artefacts that can be found there, there is no way I'll ever go near Lab X-16. Controllers and zombies roam around the place.
I heard Hermann once mentioning his intentions of hiring a group of mercs to assist our scientists in Jupiter. I concur, many research groups have disappeared lately.
Funnily enough, bolts are still the cheapest and most effective way to detect anomalous activities around.
Many don't know the difference between a Whirligig and a Vortex; the latter has a much larger range. Many have died due to wrong estimations between both kinds.
I heard that the fabled Heart of the Oasis artefact can even nourish the bearer. This is a miracle to science and medicine.
Gas anomalies are rare, but they share similar properties to those of the Fruit Punch.
Burnt Fuzz is the least dangerous type of anomalies. However, stalkers die to it because they don't expect an anomaly above their heads.
Psi-storms usually don't participate in artefact creation, massive blowouts on the other hand are a whole different story.
Organs mutate in so many novel ways: Flesh eyes with olfactory receptors, Snork tendon strength, regenerative properties in the Bloodsucker heart... even the crows demonstrate remarkable changes.
Kolobok artefacts are held extremely valuable to medical research outside the Zone. They've been known to effectively treat chronic muscular dystrophy.
I'm getting used to this gunfighting business. Never thought my field of study would lead me here...
This is the only place I know of where the specimens look for you.
I don't trust those handmade artefact containers that the stalkers make - you can't bypass factory specifications.
I'm hoping for a tenure track after this. I think I could even sell a book...
We haven't even started research on the moving anomalies: Comets and Teslas and the like.
I'd love to get my hands on some of the old research documents laying around.
I'm not so quick to dismiss the Wish Granter. I'd imagine there's something behind all the legends.
A scientist I know went missing after he ventured into Pripyat alone. Don't let ambition get you killed.
I used to think it was all campfire stories: the anomalies, the mutants, the Monolith... I know better now.
I've heard about a "Fault" anomaly: apparently it's some sort of geological Burner anomaly that pushes through the Earth's surface.
The whole situation with the Zone is a shame: this should be a quarantined site for scientific testing, not a lawless madhouse.
So many great minds have died in the Zone.
I hope that our studies into artefact properties will allow us to create more effective protective suits.
My own research project is on hold because our lead researcher was murdered and his documents stolen - it's really hard out here.
If Sakharov wants live mutant specimens, he's welcome to go out and collect them himself.
The Crystal artefact is in high demand right now - apparently it's extremely useful in rocket engines.
I should probably be taking measurements right now...
I just read a research report on the intersection of gravitational fields and how they can influence the rate of- \nAre you listening to me?
What's your interest in the Zone, $name?
Sometimes it just seems like a better idea to stay inside the mobile lab.
Duty gives us plenty of artefacts. Sometimes we try to buy them from other stalkers, but they usually want to rip us off.
It would be nice if the creatures developing in the Zone were more peaceful. How in the world do we end up with Snorks anyway?
There's nothing like the feeling of getting back to the lab with a pack full of new artefacts.
I hate all the chaos and confusion; this place is for cowboys, not scientists.
I've seen so many things I can't explain. It scares me sometimes.
Studying the Zone's flora has shown incredible genetic adaptations. It's not all hostile, but it's all fascinating.
I never imagined I'd become proficient with a rifle. Necessity truly is the mother of invention, or adaptation, in our case.
The balance of ecosystems here is precarious. One wrong move and we could see a domino effect we can't undo.
Radiation levels might be manageable now, but they fluctuate without warning. Never skip on the dosimeter check.
Sometimes, the Zone feels like it's looking back at you, learning, adapting to how we explore it.
I've started cataloging new types of anomalies. Each one seems to have its own personality almost.
The mutant wolves are evolving in ways that defy typical predatory behaviors. We're not in Kansas anymore.
Every emission is like the Earth's cry for help, a violent lash out against what's been done to it.
Understanding the Zone isn't just academic; it's about survival. Misunderstand this place, and you'll pay with your life.
The gravitational anomalies aren't just deadly; they're a window into physics that we didn't think possible.
Collecting samples from a Bloodsucker isn't high on my list of hobbies, but it's necessary for the research.
There's a theory that artefacts are just the Zone's way of reproducing or spreading. Imagine thatlife, but not as we know it.
Ever seen a Vortex in action? Sucks everything in, then spits it out like a child bored with its toys.
The Zone challenges our understanding of biology. Mutants here defy what we thought were evolutionary constants.
If only the government would fund us properly, imagine the breakthroughs we could achieve with unlimited resources.
Some days, I think the Zone is more alive than any of us, maybe it's aware, responding to our actions, our intrusions.
The 'Fireflies' anomaly still eludes my understanding. It's beautiful yet terrifyingly deadly.
Our work might seem obscure to some, but one day, it could save humanity from its own follies.
We're not just collecting artefacts; we're collecting the keys to understand the universe's deeper mysteries.
The risk of contamination is high, but the potential for discovery is higher. It's a calculated risk we take daily.
I once found a plant here that could cure radiation sickness. Shame it's as rare as a honest politician.
Ever been caught in an emission, $name? It's like the world's screaming at you to leave, but you're too damn stubborn to listen.
Some say the Zone's a punishment from the gods. If that's true, we're all sinners paying for our crimes against nature.
The military might think they control the Zone, but they're just guests in a place where even the air can kill you.
Studying anomalies is like trying to solve a puzzle where the pieces keep changing shape and biting you.
The Zone's like a cat playing with its prey. It'll let you think you've got it figured out, then it'll pounce and prove you dead wrong.
The Monolith cult might be crazy, but they're not stupid. They know things about the Zone even we don't.
Every time I go out into the Zone, I wonder if I'll make it back. Guess that's just part of the job.
I've seen stalkers come back from the Zone with stories that'd make your hair stand on end. Sometimes, I wish I could forget what I've heard.
They say the Zone's expanding, swallowing up more and more territory. Makes you wonder what'll happen when it's finally had its fill.
If you're not careful out here, you'll end up a statistic in some ecologist's research paper. Let's try to avoid that, huh?
The Zone's like a canvas, $name. But instead of paint, it's got anomalies, mutants, and enough danger to keep any artist on their toes.
I've lost count of how many times I've almost bitten it out here. Guess I've got more lives than a cat.
Wish I could spend more time in the lab and less time dodging bullets. But hey, you gotta do what you gotta do.
There's a rumor going around that some big-shot scientist wants to turn the Zone into a nature reserve. Good luck with that.
Ever wonder if the Zone's trying to communicate with us? Maybe it's just saying "go home" in its own special way.
If you think the Zone's bad now, imagine what it was like during the disaster. Gives me chills just thinking about it.
Some say the Zone's cursed, others say it's a blessing in disguise. Me? I just want to survive long enough to find out.
The Zone doesn't care who you are or what you believe. It'll chew you up and spit you out just the same.
Every time I think I've seen it all, the Zone proves me wrong. It's like a never-ending nightmare.
Don't let the beauty of the Zone fool you, $name. It's a beast that'll tear you apart if you let your guard down.
The Zone's got a way of making you question everything you thought you knew about the world. Sometimes I wonder if that's a good thing or a bad thing.
It's easy to get lost in the mysteries of the Zone, $name. Just remember to keep one foot grounded in reality, or you'll end up like the rest of the lost souls out here.
For every discovery we make in the Zone, there's a hundred more questions waiting to be answered. It's like peeling back the layers of an onion, only the onion's trying to kill you.
The Zone's like a cruel teacher, $name. It'll give you all the lessons you never wanted to learn, whether you're ready for them or not.
Don't get too attached to anything or anyone in the Zone, $name. They'll either die, betray you, or both.
The best and worst thing about the Zone is that it's always changing. Keeps you on your toes, but it also means you can never let your guard down.
Some say the Zone's a living, breathing entity. If that's true, then we're nothing more than ants crawling on its skin.
There's a thin line between bravery and stupidity out here, $name. Let's make sure we stay on the right side of it.
If you ever start feeling like you've got the Zone all figured out, $name, that's when it'll really start messing with you.
Don't let the silence of the Zone fool you, $name. It's just biding its time, waiting for the perfect moment to strike.
They say ignorance is bliss. Well, $name, out here, ignorance will get you killed.
It's not just the mutants and anomalies we have to watch out for, $name. It's the other humans. They're the real monsters in the Zone.
Every time I think about leaving the Zone for good, something pulls me back in. Maybe it's curiosity, maybe it's stupidity. Probably a bit of both.
There's a saying in the Zone: adapt or die. Personally, I'm getting real tired of adapting.
Some people come to the Zone looking for answers. Me? I just came looking for trouble. Turns out, I found both.
They say the Zone's like a second chance at life. Personally, I think whoever said that never set foot in the Zone.
Every time I close my eyes, all I see is the Zone. It's like it's seeped into my soul, and I can never escape it.
Some people say the Zone's a prison. Me? I say it's a playground for the damned.
They say the Zone's haunted, $name. But what they don't tell you is that the real ghosts are the ones still breathing.
Stay sharp, Duty scumbags may show up any time.
Voronin keeps sending scouts to that farm over the hill. They never learn, don't they?
Hey $name, if you're feeling sick, let me know and I will let my friend patch you up, you won't regret it.
"Maintaining order in the Zone", best joke I've ever heard.
Monolith forces are giving our guys at the Barrier a hard time. It was never easy actually, I don't envy them.
Gotta admit, Duty did a great job protecting the Bar from the dogs so far. That's impressive.
Yo $name, got a lighter? I left mine in the camp.
I don't mind having the bandits around, as long as they stay out of our way.
There is no law in the Zone, gotta keep that in mind.
Shit, I feel a bit dizzy.
Sooner or later, we will free the Zone from those who abuse its treasures.
Got anything on you, bro?
Don't forget to savor the moment.
I consider myself a lover, but hey - the wildlife here doesn't give a shit. This is why we bring shooters.
You gonna hang with me, $name? Too many flakes in the Zone.
Sleep next to artefacts and you'll get mind powers and shit. Or they'll mess you up.
People can't even let you chill, not even in here...
Smell that fresh air, man.
Free Zone, my dude. The Zone is a middle finger to humanity's bullshit.
Think meta, bro. That's what Loki told me.
You can plan all you want, but what does anything out here care about that?
You know what? I don't care what they say, $name - I think you're all right.
Don't make a trail. We just need to slip through the Zone, not battle our way through.
Rigid things break under stress - you've got to be flexible, man.
The thing about Freedom is that we care about each other.
Where do you think Skinflint gets all his shit? I don't think he's getting it from Greenpeace...
It can be scary sometimes... but it's beautiful, too.
I should really get a decent night's sleep one of these days.
Freedom to do whatever you want, right? Then why do I end up getting ordered around all the time?
It's been forever since I've seen Hawaiian. That guy is really chill.
Lost four more guys at the Barrier last week... is it even going to end?
What a shitty headache. It's fine - I'm alright.
So much activity... so much work... I just want to sit on my ass, you know?
Everything else in here's adapting - why don't we adapt? That reminds me of that one guy pushing "radiation therapy".
It's gonna be so much better when we finally push Duty out of here.
I think we could always use more flexibility in Freedom; I don't really go for this hierarchy crap.
Keep it loose, $name.
Freedom is an idea - Freedom doesn't die!
You seem like the kind of guy who would pull off some stunt to impress the boss. Don't do anything too stupid, ok?
You gotta break the system or you end up living in it.
Stay chill, man. Those Duty dudes could pop up anywhere.
Voronin's scouts keep going to that farm over and over. They never learn, do they?
