Hey, if you're feeling rough, let me know. My buddy's got some good stuff that'll fix you right up.
Maintaining order in the Zone? That's the funniest shit I've heard all day.
Those Monolith guys are really giving our Barrier crew a hard time lately. Not cool, man.
Gotta hand it to Duty - they're doing a decent job keeping the Bar safe from the mutts.
Yo, got a light? Left mine back at camp.
Bandits are whatever, man. As long as they don't mess with us, I'm cool.
No laws out here, bro. Just gotta roll with it.
Feeling a bit woozy...
One day, we'll liberate the Zone from all this corporate bullshit.
Got any snacks on you, bro?
Take a moment to enjoy the vibes, man.
Love and peace, but always pack heat. Never know what this place will throw at you.
Wanna hang, $name? Too many buzzkills in the Zone.
Sleeping next to artefacts supposedly gives you mind powers, or totally messes you up.
Can't catch a break even out here...
Breathe in that fresh air, man.
Freedom, dude. The Zone's like a big "fuck you" to all the rules.
Think outside the box, bro. Loki's all about that shit.
Duty fucks can pop out of any shithole. Keep your eyes peeled and your finger on the trigger.
Voronin's lapdogs sniffing around again. They're like a bad STD, never really go away.
If you're feeling fucked up, hit me up. I know a guy who mixes better stuff than any pharmacy.
Order in the Zone? That's the biggest pile of bullshit I've ever heard.
Monolith dickheads are swarming the Barrier like flies on shit. Makes you miss the simpler times.
Props to Duty, though. Keeping the Bar clear of those four-legged fucks is no small feat.
Anyone got a fucking light? Lost mine while tripping balls in the camp last night.
Bandits? As long as they don't fuck with our stash, they can piss off to wherever.
No rules in this godforsaken place. It's every badass for themselves.
Fuck, my head's spinning. Might've hit that stash a bit too hard.
We're gonna tear down every last one of those power-hungry fuckers trying to cage the Zone.
Got anything good on you, or you just gonna stand there looking lost?
Don't just rush through life, man. Even in this hellhole, there's shit worth enjoying.
I'm all for peace and love, but in the Zone, you gotta be ready to pop a cap in someone's ass at any moment.
You sticking around, $name? Zone's full of snakes and rats.
Sleeping next to artefacts might fuck your brain up, but damn, the dreams are wild.
Everyone's so wound up. Just take a fucking chill pill, will ya?
That's the smell of freedom, my friend. Nothing but pure, unadulterated Zone air.
The Zone's the ultimate 'fuck you' to the establishment. That's why we're here.
Keep thinking outside the box, $name. That box is a fucking coffin if you're not careful.
To be honest, I don't really feel comfortable about killing all those people. But hey, work is work, and I need to make a living.
The scientists were looking for bodyguards, they're having a hard time dealing with mutants and bandits.
One of my clients asked me to go with him hunting artefacts. I refused, that's not what I was trained for.
Dushman got new contracts for us, I will check that out on my way back.
Being a hitman isn't an easy thing.
If you need something done, I can offer my services... At the right price, of course.
Always go for the squad leader first, this will distract the rest for good.
I can help you with your bounty contracts, we can split the money after that.
Artefact hunting is actually quite common among mercs, especially those who prefer to stay away from killing others.
I always keep a pistol around. You can never go wrong with a reliable, fast sidearm.
I wonder what happened to Scar. You know, the legendary merc who assisted Clear Sky before that big emission, right?\nPeople say he died, others say he became a Monolith leader... Is it possible that he might still be alive?
You can make easy money out of Freedom - Duty conflicts, both offer assassination contracts on each other's targets.
Monolith assassination contracts make me nervous... don't you dare telling anyone that I've said that.
As long as bandits don't interfere with my contracts, I don't mind seeing them around.
Stalkers are usually the easiest targets in the Zone. Sometimes I feel bad about killing one.
Don't make it personal. Just get it done.
An untrustworthy ally is worse than an enemy; pick your friends well.
Just know that every plan can go south, so have an escape plan.
Talking is cheap, there's no substitute for doing.
When you pick up a contract, you should know everything about it: not only the target and the circumstances, but also what part you play in the events and who stands to get something out of it.
I'm thinking about renewing my contract after my time is up.
I could really use some high-end night-vision optics, but I'm not spending a half-months pay for it.
I've never seen such a high attrition rate.
Some of our guys get cocky and go off on missions alone; you really need to know what you're doing to do that.
The ones that get drunk every night never last long.
Don't let anyone tell you otherwise: armor plates have saved my skin more than once.
There's some mutants that you can really only hunt at night. Usually, they're the ones hunting you.
Keep your knife real handy and practice arming yourself with it. Or else you can end up as one of these corpses by the side of the road.
More operators being dropped in soon. The Zone needs to be fed, I guess.
Aslan's always got work, if you don't mind doing what you're told. You go down the rabbit hole and you don't know where you'll end up.
I always pack two more full mags than I think I need.
I prefer to be far away when my target dies - the less you're involved, the better.
Keep your ears open and just let the other guy talk - you have no idea the sort of intel we get off of these stalkers.
I heard Hatchet works for the scientists full-time now. I don't grudge him that - he's a good soldier.
Soldiers of Fortune... Dogs of War... We don't give a damn what the killing is for. As long as we get our due.
Too many teams have gone down into those labs never to be seen again. It's a fucking nightmare down there: no intel, no floor-plans and no escape routes.
You better be cool under fire, $name.
I heard some guys make good money hunting mutants for their parts. Apparently, some people on the outside will pay huge amounts for it, but good luck getting those prices selling in the Zone.
I remember the deep-recon patrols... that's some stuff you never forget. The north of the Zone is like nothing else.
Whoever lands the first shot is going to win. Never stop paying attention, or it will be over before you know what happened.
My friend found some rare artefacts in Zaton, I need to get a good detector.
Those Ukrainian army bastards think they can order stalkers around. "We are here to protect you from the Zone", my ass.
Man, Sidorovich's prices are unbelievable.
Stay alert, bandits may show up any time soon.
Those bloody bandits think they can stroll around and rob stalkers just like that, they are gonna pay for it.
Hey, let's avoid the military checkpoints, I don't want to commit suicide today.
I haven't decided yet what's best for me. Artefact hunting is profitable, delivery jobs are not that bad either.
Duty and Freedom confused me for a long time, both have got good points and ideals.
I can still hear Duty megaphones inside my head, what the hell...
$name, have you ever considered the Arena? Seems like a good deal.
I wanna visit the 100 Rads Bar. Barkeep's got all sorts of drinks, and I'm in the mood for one.
Moving out from Cordon to Rostok isn't a piece of cake, you can thank bandits for that.
Beard was offering jobs about hunting specific artefacts, too bad I don't own a good detector...
My friend said once to never trust a merc. You might be his friend today, and his contract tomorrow.
I came here looking for work and opportunities, I want throw my old life behind. What about you, $name?
Always keep your eyes open, $name - opportunities are everywhere.
Survive another day is my motto.
Always nice to have another fighter, $name.
You never know what kind of people you will run into in the Zone...
If only those military pricks would leave off hunting us and actually take care of the bandit problem.
I'm finding getting out of the Zone to be much harder than getting in...
Sometimes I think we loners need to stick together more.
I shouldn't have been cheap with the ammo.
Gotta keep your shooter clean or you're asking for a bad turn.
Most of those guys that earn a load of money don't ever get to spend it. You should remember that.
I prefer a headlamp - you don't want to be fumbling around with a torch when you get jumped in the dark.
Hear any news about the north?
Smell that radiation!
Damn, I've got tinnitus. Should have listened when they warned me about it.
I wonder what's going on in my home town. Never thought I'd miss that place.
What do you think? Fat bacon or Boar chops? I used to think that Flesh had a funny rancid flavor, but it's growing on me. Boar is way too lean - no fat.
Some say vodka gets rid of radiation... I just think you get too drunk to care.
Some superstitious bastards in the Zone; I've seen a grown man tremble because he broke a shoelace.
It takes a strong man to retain a sense of humor in the Zone.
I miss a good film.
The thing about trusting in luck is that it never keeps up. Celebrate today, weep tomorrow.
Lead the way - I don't mind you going first.
Too much talk usually means you don't hear the Chimera coming.
People are saying that the Monolith are putting up a fresh attack on the south. That shit worries me more than anything else.
So many ways to die out here... you can't think about it. Screw everything, push on!
Keep your damn eyes peeled, $name. You blink, you miss, you die. That simple.
Surviving here's like a bad joke that's gone on too long. You laugh so you don't cry.
Glad to have another gun around. Hope you shoot better than you look.
This Zone's a cesspool of freaks and fiends... and I'm not just talking about the mutants.
If the military spent half as much time on the bandits as they do on us, we might actually have some peace around here.
Getting in was easy. Getting out? It's like this damn place has a mind of its own.
We loners gotta band together. It's the only way some of us are gonna make it.
Next time, I'm paying top dollar for ammo. Cheap shit's nearly got me killed twice now.
Keep that gun oiled, rookie. A jam at the wrong time is a death sentence out here.
All the riches here, and most don't live long enough to spend a damn ruble. Don't let that be you.
Headlamp over a flashlight any day. You wanna be able to shoot and see at the same time, right?
Any word from the north? I hear it's getting hotter up there, and not in a good way.
That radiation's got a particular stink, huh? Like the breath of the devil himself.
My ears are ringing like church bells. Should've thought twice about those cheap earplugs.
Wonder what they're up to back home. Bet they wouldn't even recognize me now.
Flesh or Boar tonight? Whatever it is, it better not be as tough as last time.
They say vodka cleanses radiation. Bullshit. But after a few shots, who the hell cares?
Superstition's the real killer out here. Watch a grown man lose it over spilled salt.
A sense of humor will save your sanity around these parts. Lose that, and you're as good as dead.
I miss a good old-fashioned movie night. Out here, it's live action 24/7, and you're the star.
Luck's like a bandit's promise: not worth much. Today it smiles, tomorrow it stabs you in the back.
Go ahead, lead the way. I've got your back... mostly.
Keep the chatter low. You don't want to gab your way into a grave.
Rumors are swirling about a big push from Monolith in the south. That's trouble we don't need.
Death comes in many flavors here. Pick one; they all end the same way.
Another day, another artifact hunt. Gotta make sure to pack extra filters today.
Man, I could really go for a hot meal. Too bad all we've got are these stale rations.
If you're heading out to the anomalies, count me in. Just need to grab my bolt bag.
Hey $name, you check the radiation levels today? My Geiger's been acting up.
Don't forget to clean your mask tonight. You don't want to wake up coughing up something nasty.
Think it's gonna rain later? Better pack the tarps or it'll be a wet night at camp.
Got any duct tape? My boot's practically talking with how much it's flapping.
Let's hit the trading post later. I heard they got a new shipment of batteries.
I need to patch up my jacket again; those damn thorns are relentless.
Keep an ear out for engines. If it's not a stalker, it's likely bandits looking for trouble.
We should check the traps by the northern ridge. Might get lucky with some mutant game.
How's your water filter holding up? Mine's seen better days.
Make sure to double-check your ammo before we head out. No room for errors today.
Hey, let's organize the gear tonight. Last time it was a mess and we wasted hours sorting it out.
Need to gather some firewood before it gets dark. Want to help me out?
If you're going to the market, can you pick up some wire? I'm all out and this radio won't fix itself.
That stash needs sorting. We can't keep digging through it every time we need something.
Think you can help me recalibrate my scope? It's been off since that fall last week.
Let's get some rest tonight. Tomorrow's trek is not going to be an easy one.
I hear there's a stalker in the camp who knows how to fix up suits. We should talk to him before ours get any worse.
We need to sweep the perimeter tonight. Can't have any more surprises like last time.
Make sure your headlamp batteries are charged. Nothing worse than a blackout when you're knee-deep in the Zone.
Always check your back, $name. It's not just the mutants; the Zone itself has a way of creeping up on you.
Hey rookie, ever stepped foot in an anomaly? It's like dancing with death, only death's got better moves.
Listen up, greenhorn. Ever heard the mutants howl at night? Yeah, that's the lullaby of the damned.
Got any spare filters, kid? Because if you don't, you'll be coughing up more radiation than a Chernobyl survivor.
You know what they say about rookies, right? They're like fresh meat in a pack of starving wolves. Don't be that snack.
Got a light? Good. 'Cause in this darkness, one wrong move and you'll be lighting up the Zone like a Roman candle.
Keep your weapon close, newbie. The Zone's got more surprises than a birthday party at a haunted house.
Don't be a dumbass like the last rookie. He thought he could pet a Bloodsucker. Spoiler alert: he ended up as its chew toy.
Feeling lucky, kid? Well, luck ain't gonna save you when a pack of mutants decides you're their next meal.
Got any smokes, rookie? Might as well enjoy one last drag before the Zone turns you into a crispy critter.
Stay close, greenhorn. You wander off, you'll end up lost in the Zone faster than you can say "I screwed up."
Think you're tough, kid? Well, toughen up even more. The Zone's got a way of turning tough guys into whimpering babies.
Here's some advice, rookie: don't trust anyone, don't touch anything, and for the love of all that's holy, don't die. Got it?
Brother, show no mercy to those who stand against the Monolith's will.
May the Monolith be with you, $name.
We thank you, oh Monolith, for revealing the cunning plans of your enemies to us.
We need to avenge our fallen brothers, let's move.
Clear Sky paid dearly for interfering with the Monolith's plans once, others will follow.
$name, the Monolith has blessed us with wonderful artefacts. Bring as many as you can find to our base.
Be careful brother, the enemy may show up at any moment.
Bring death to those who spurn the holy power of the Monolith.
Our duty to the Monolith transcends mortal understanding. We serve as instruments of its divine will.
As disciples of the Monolith, we embrace sacrifice in the name of its glorious cause. Our faith is unwavering.
Through the Monolith's guidance, we are granted strength beyond measure. It is our duty to wield it against all who oppose us.
Every victory over our enemies is a testament to the Monolith's supremacy. Its power flows through us, driving us forward in holy conquest.
Those who defy the Monolith shall face divine retribution. Their insolence will be met with righteous fury.
Under the Monolith's watchful gaze, we march as one, united in purpose and devotion. None can stand against our righteous might.
Even in the face of adversity, our faith in the Monolith remains unshaken. Its wisdom guides us through the darkest of times.
Every victory is a testament to the Monolith's divine providence. Its blessings are showered upon those who serve it faithfully.
The Monolith's voice echoes in our minds, guiding our every action. Its will is absolute, and we are but humble servants.
Let the unbelievers tremble before the might of the Monolith. Their defiance shall only hasten their inevitable demise.
Through the Monolith, we are granted glimpses of the future. Its visions guide us towards our ultimate destiny.
As guardians of the Monolith, we stand as a bulwark against the encroaching darkness. Our resolve is unyielding, our purpose clear.
The Monolith's embrace offers solace in the chaos of the Zone. In its presence, we find strength and purpose.
Those who seek to oppose the Monolith shall find only despair. Its power is absolute, its judgement swift and unforgiving.
Our allegiance to the Monolith transcends mortal concerns. We are its chosen, blessed with its divine favor.
Through the Monolith's guidance, we shall cleanse the Zone of all who dare to defy its will. None shall escape its righteous fury.
As servants of the Monolith, we embrace our divine purpose. In its name, we shall bring about a new era of enlightenment.
The Monolith's whispers guide our every step, leading us towards our ultimate destiny. Its wisdom is beyond comprehension, its power unmatched.
Through the Monolith's grace, we are granted visions of a future bathed in its divine light. We shall usher in this new age, one victory at a time.
Even in the face of adversity, our faith in the Monolith remains unshakeable. Its presence fills us with strength and purpose.
Those who stand against the Monolith shall know the full extent of its wrath. Their defiance shall be met with swift and merciless retribution.
As disciples of the Monolith, we are blessed with its divine protection. None can stand against us, for we are the chosen of the Zone.
Hey, $name, pass me that artifact. Let's see if the Monolith blesses us with something good this time.
Man, I could use a break. You think the Monolith would mind if we took a quick nap?
Got any spare rations, $name? I'm starving over here.
Watch your step, brother. Don't want to trip and end up as mutant chow, do we?
So, $name, what's your favorite artifact so far? I've got a soft spot for those energy anomalies.
Ever wonder what the Monolith's voice sounds like? I bet it's something majestic.
Think we'll run into any stalkers out here? Always good for target practice.
Man, this Zone sure has its share of weird stuff. Ever seen anything like it?
Hey, $name, you ever think about what you'll do when we finally cleanse the Zone?
Nothing like a good fire and some Zone stories to pass the time. You got any good ones?
Whew, these packs are getting heavier by the minute. Remind me why we lug all this gear around?
Man, I miss the taste of real food. When was the last time you had a decent meal, $name?
Just a few more clicks to our destination. You holding up okay, $name?
I'm so used to this place, it's getting really old.
Home sweet home.
Are we staying here for long?
Feels good to be here. Our fellas are guarding the place.
I need to explore the rest of the Zone, staying here won't help.
Been here for quite a long time.
Good time to stock up on supplies.
It's not great, but it's better than the rest of the Zone.
Good place for a rest.
I always feel more safe inside four walls.
Do we have to go? I like this place.
Usually you can get a good night's sleep here.
Ah, back to the same old shit...
Home sweet goddamn home.
Time to kick back and relax for a bit.
Hope there's some decent booze around here...
Feels like a fucking luxury being inside these walls.
Don't get too comfortable, $name. We'll be out there again soon enough.
Finally, a chance to catch our breath...
Let's hope nobody tries to stab us in our sleep this time...
Got any spare smokes? I'm running low...
I could use a fucking drink after that shitshow out there.
Can't believe we made it back in one piece...
Time to see if anyone's got any good gossip around here...
Let's hope nobody's stolen our shit while we were gone...
Ah, back to the same old grind...
I could use a hot meal and a warm bed right about now...
Let's hope we don't run into any assholes while we're here.
Time to restock on ammo and bandages...
Don't get too comfortable, $name. We'll be back out there soon enough.
Why does it feel like we're always running from something out there?
Guess it's time to mingle with the other lowlifes...
Let's hope nobody decides to start shit while we're trying to relax...
Feels like a fucking miracle every time we make it back in one piece...
Wonder if anyone's got any decent gear to trade...
Time to see if anyone's got a job worth taking...
Let's hope the local shitheads haven't caused too much trouble while we were gone...
Back to the same old routine...
I could use a stiff drink after that shitshow outside...
Time to find a quiet corner and get some fucking shut-eye...
Hope someone's got some interesting stories to tell...
Let's hope the local boss has some good jobs lined up...
Feels like we've been away for fucking ages...
Another day, another goddamn safe zone...
Time to see if anyone's managed to brew up some decent moonshine...
Let's hope the locals haven't forgotten about us...
Back to the same old faces...
Another day, another fucking safe zone...
Time to see if anyone's got any new gear to show off...
Feels like we've been running non-stop...
Hope there's some decent grub to be had around here...
Let's hope nobody's decided to stir up any shit while we were out...
Back to the same old cesspit...
I could use a fucking break from all this madness...
Time to see if anyone's got any interesting rumors to share...
Feels like we've been on the run forever...
Let's hope the local traders haven't jacked up their prices again...
Back to the same old shitshow...
Time to restock on smokes and booze...
Feels like we've been fighting for our lives forever...
Hope nobody's started any turf wars while we were away...
Back to the same old fucking grind...
Time to see if anyone's got any new leads on artifacts...
Feels like we've been running from mutants non-stop...
Hope the local traders haven't run out of ammo...
Back to the same old fucking routine...
Time to see if anyone's got any good bounties to collect...
Feels like we've been running on fumes for days...
Hope someone's got some decent food to trade...
Back to the same old fucking bullshit...
Time to see if anyone's got any new toys for sale...
Feels like we've been dodging bullets left and right...
Hope nobody's taken over our spot while we were gone...
Back to the same old fucking grind...
Time to see if anyone's got any new rumors to spread...
Feels like we've been on the run forever...
Hope the local traders haven't run out of booze...
Back to the same old fucking shitshow...
Time to see if anyone's got any new jobs worth taking...
Feels like we've been fighting for our lives non-stop...
Hope nobody's fucked with our gear while we were out...
Back to the same old fucking grind...
Time to see if anyone's got any new leads on stashes...
Feels like we've been dodging mutants left and right...
Hope the local traders haven't marked up their prices...
Back to the same old fucking routine...
Time to see if anyone's got any new bounties for us...
Feels like we've been running on empty for days...
Hope someone's got some decent gear to trade...
Back to the same old fucking bullshit...
Time to see if anyone's got any new toys for sale...
Feels like we've been dodging bullets left and right...
Hope nobody's taken over our spot while we were gone...
Back to the same old fucking grind...
Time to see if anyone's got any new rumors to spread...
Feels like we've been on the run forever...
Hope the local traders haven't run out of booze...
Back to the same old fucking shitshow...
Time to see if anyone's got any new jobs worth taking...
Feels like we've been fighting for our lives non-stop...
Hope nobody's fucked with our gear while we were out...
Back to the same old fucking grind...
Time to see if anyone's got any new leads on stashes...
Feels like we've been dodging mutants left and right...
Hope the local traders haven't marked up their prices...
Back to the same old fucking routine...
Time to see if anyone's got any new bounties for us...
Feels like we've been running on empty for days...
Hope someone's got some decent gear to trade...
I'm not comfortable with this...
Would you look at this place...
This used to be a town built for the engineers and the personnel working at the Chernobyl NPP...
It was quite a big place once, it is a ghost town now, with mutants and Monolith as the only residents.
The famous Ferris Wheel... it's even bigger than what I imagined.
The former Pripyat Stadium became a battleground infested with Monolith troops.
So visiting this place is your greatest idea?!
We are far behind enemy lines, I hope you know what you're doing...
Get ready for Monolith troops, they will show up at any moment now.
Why did I agree on coming along with you...
Shit... there's too many angles here. I feel exposed.
Let's do what we have to do and get out of here, ok?
The famous Pripyat...
This is not a great place to be.
I heard that the artefacts around here are really good. That is, if those murderous maniacs let us by...
I had a buddy who went missing up here. There are worse fates than death...
I wouldn't feel safe around here with twenty more guys.
I've heard about the tunnel that goes underground; if you had heard what I heard...
This place is Monolith central...
City of mutants and brainwashed freaks.
Just keep your head down and follow my lead, $name.
Every step we take here feels like tempting fate...
I've got a bad feeling about this place...
Remind me again why we thought coming here was a good idea...
Just try not to get us killed, $name.
Why couldn't we have just stayed in the safe zone?
If we make it out of here alive, remind me to never come back...
Keep your eyes peeled for any signs of trouble...
Why does it feel like we're walking into a death trap?
I've heard stories about this place... none of them good.
If we're lucky, we might just survive this...
Just stay close and keep your weapon ready, $name.
I hope you know what you're doing, because I sure as hell don't...
Remind me to punch you in the face later for dragging me here...
Can we please just get what we came for and leave?
I've got a bad feeling about this...
This place gives me the creeps...
Just try not to get us killed, $name.
I'll be glad when we're out of here...
If we're not careful, we'll end up as mutant chow...
Just keep moving and don't look back...
Why couldn't we have just stayed in the safe zone?
I've got a really bad feeling about this...
This place is giving me the heebie-jeebies...
Let's make this quick and get the hell out of here...
I've got a bad feeling about this...
Let's just try to get what we came for without getting killed...
This place is like a nightmare come to life...
Keep your weapon ready and your wits about you...
If we're not careful, we'll end up dead...
Rookies' home, everyone starts from somewhere after all.
The border, I won't mind staying here.
The Ukrainian military guards couldn't stop stalkers from breaking through, after all.
How's that old fat ass doing these days... Still ripping people off I presume.
Stalkers spotted bloodsuckers near the tunnels once. It's not safe, not even here.
One day you see bandits inhabiting the Car Park, next day it's the loners' turn.
The Railway bridge used to be the second gate to the Zone, I don't think the army has control over it any more.
The Mill is a good place to hide a stash, stalkers usually don't stay in there.
If I'm not mistaken, there is a technician in the northern farm.
The situation at the outpost is unstable. Many parties are fighting over it.
The outside world is so close...
It's a long way to the power plant.
Don't take it too easy - even out here.
The Garbage is to the north, that forest path is in the east and the big swamp in the west. All so enticing!
They say that you can see a crashed Death Truck around here.
It's usually pretty quiet around here.
The train tracks cut Cordon in half; whoever holds it has a good advantage.
I heard this place is right in the middle of mutant migration paths.
It's too crowded around here - let's go north!
Not much here in the way of artefacts.
This is where most of us cut our teeth. Feels like coming home... if home was infested with mutants and bandits.
A lot of fresh faces around here. They've got no idea what they're getting into, poor bastards.
The rookie camp? Its basically a crash course in not dying. Not everyone passes.
If the Zone had a welcome mat, it would be laid out right here... with landmines under it.
Rookie Village is just a stone's throw from here. Its more like a graveyard for dreams than a safe haven.
The bridge? Its an unofficial checkpoint. You pay with your wallet or your life. Bandit's choice.
They call it the Cordon. Sounds like a safe place. Its not.
Look out for the military patrols. Theyre not here for our protection - more like collection... or execution.
Keep low and move fast. The military doesn't like to ask questions before pulling the trigger.
See those buildings? Bullet holes and burn marks tell you all you need to know about Cordons history.
If silence is golden, then the Cordon is broke. There's always gunfire echoing somewhere.
This place might look calm, but it's just the eye of the storm. You'll see.
That old checkpoint up ahead? Watch it. Could be mutants, could be bandits, could be both.
At the edge of the Zone, the Cordon is like a sieve; only the really unlucky or really stupid get caught here.
Between us and freedom is a whole lot of Zone. Don't get comfortable.
Avoid the farmstead unless you want to run into a squabble. It's a hotbed for turf wars.
That derelict machinery? It's not just a landmark. It's a reminder that the past won't just lie down and die.
Some say the Zone is alive, that it breathes and thinks. If that's true, Cordon is its front porch.
If you're hoping to find riches, you're better off picking pockets in Rostok. Not much but scraps here.
The road through here might lead out, but it's littered with more traps than treasures.
This graveyard gives me the creeps, I heard many stalkers vanished while moving between the vehicles.
Would you look at this, what a shitty depressing place.
Duty and bandits have some presence here, but no-one goes too deep.
Stay away from the middle area, I don't wanna be food for bloodsuckers today.
Those tanks and vehicles lying around are quite radioactive, you better have a good gas mask.
Vortex anomalies are common around here, watch your step.
You can hide in the camp in the north-eastern side. It's a good place to stay safe from emissions.
It's a lonely, forsaken place.
All these empty husks with no-one inside... they're just like us.
I keep hearing stories of Chimeras in here - I can well believe it.
It's a graveyard. The Zone is a graveyard...
Rust, rust, rust.
Lots of little monsters have their nests in here.
Those trash piles in the north are totally irradiated, but I've heard they have artefacts in them.
There are much better places to be. I think I'd rather be in the Wild Territory than this waste.
Some people say that people hide treasures in here. Usually, the best you can find is a quick death.
Eh, we got a long road ahead of us.
You know what we really need right now? A freaking car.
Be careful, I feel like something is waiting for us behind those trees.
Bandits usually hide at the bridge, waiting for rookies to show up.
Pseudodogs are quite common here, I hope we don't meet a hungry one.
Looking at the rails, this place used to be a big train station. Now it's just an empty forest.
We can stop by the warehouse to rest for a bit, although I'm not sure who's controlling it.
Damn, it can be quiet here. It's... sort of comforting.
There's probably a reason why nobody goes this way.
Nature is not as messed-up here as in other places.
A good place to go when you want to get away.
Don't drowse off: there's plenty of dangers here.
Lots of things creep around in the underbrush.
The only settled place around here is the old logging building in the woods.
What are we trying to do in here?
The trains used to connect parts of the Pripyat area; obviously, they're out of commission now.
I hate swamps.
What are we exactly doing here? Watching the frogs?
This place is no joke, walk in the water for a few minutes if you want to join the zombies.
No-one knows what's waiting for us behind those reeds.
The view isn't that bad.
I think I caught bugs in my ass, and staying in this swampy place isn't helping it.
It looks like Clear Sky is back in business. I can't say the same for the Renegades, though.
Did you know, the swamps were not always a marshland. This area used to be a farming region, with villages and fields.
If I'm not mistaken, the pump station was built in order to extract anomalous substances from the bottom of the swamps.
There's a machine yard near the north-eastern part. Renegades used to control the place.
Have you ever been to the old church? It's beautiful yet creepy at the same time.
You can find some stashes in those farms... if you're lucky enough.
I don't want to know what lives in the water...
The armpit of the Zone.
This place is just unhealthy.
The old church probably used to be an impressive building.
All sorts of anomalies here; the Zone has been very generous with its gifts.
I need some good boots for all this muck.
Strange to think that people lived in this marsh. It wasn't a marsh then, of course.
The moisture alone is enough to drench you even without the sweating.
Did you hear that? What in the hell...
I think I would go insane if I had to live here.
We should probably stick together, eh? It's really easy to get lost.
What's that lovely aroma? Rotting swamp carcasses, probably.
I... I can't believe my eyes..... we made it to the centre!
I'm still alive...
The centre of the Zone... the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant is lying right in front of us...
We made it...
After all this time, the Power Planet itself...
The centre... We've finally made it to the centre...
I have never been this nervous in my whole life...
We are going to have some stories to tell...
Keep your eyes fucking peeled.
This is where it all started.
Be ready for anything. Shit, what are we doing here?
This place is huge.
We're a long way from the Cordon...
Just think - the Wish Granter could be right over there.
Not many people have seen this place and lived to tell the tale.
I am not prepared for this.
This place is so quiet, and creepy.
Ever wondered what kinds of stuff we can find in those buildings?
Watch your step, a friend of mine once told me about old forgotten mines lying around.
Monolith squads roam the area in the north, they come from the Deserted Hospital.
The mercenaries are having a hard time holding the road to Dead City.
I have a feeling that one day the Monolith will seize control over the whole city.
North of here is all Monolith territory.
Better keep your head down or you'll catch a stray bullet.
The battle goes back and forth; lots of casualties with little change.
So many death alleys - watch for anomaly patches.
This used to be a secondary town for the power plant workers. Some secret stuff went on around here...
See that huge radar array on the hill? I've heard all sorts of things about it. Monolith seem to have some interest in it.
This is not a friendly place.
It's so tense around here.
I've heard that bloodsuckers live in those buildings.
From what I've heard, the fanatics have a series of strong-points that they hold. Trust me, this place is a fortress.
It's pretty rare for a stalker team to make it over the river.
This place has got to hold or the whole south is in trouble.
Zombies wander around the area, it's called Dead City after all.
I wonder if we can find anything good inside those buildings.
The situation here is tense, mercs and bandits are known for fighting each others over the mid area.
The main base for the mercs is here, usually they don't allow outsiders to wander near their hideout.
The statue of Lenin is bigger than what I imagined.
Mercs took control over the sports centre. Bandits got the old school.
You know, the city was stripped of most of its valuables. Now it's an empty shell of its former self.
My friend told me about a tunnel system beneath the city, a whole grid connects every building around.
This place is so dreary... no wonder the mercs are so unfriendly.
Dead City... sounds about right.
Place gives me the creeps.
The mercenary base is not as secret as it used to be.
This place is like one big corpse.
Maybe those mercenaries will give us a tour, eh?
Some of the old tenement buildings are falling down.
There's plenty of anomalies in the outer fields; if you go sneaking around there, you need to watch your step.
Our merc friends might not like us wandering around their HQ...
The mercs tried to pick a place that was inaccessible to stalkers, but they can always find a way.
I can feel the psi-waves already.
The Miracle Machine exists somewhere around here. It's quite dangerous to get in range.
I don't wanna be zombies' soup today, let's keep moving.
When someone mentions Yantar, the first two things that come to my mind are zombies and snorks.
You can try to make your way to Dead City from here, but local mutants may not like it.
Yantar wasn't always a swampy, desolate place you know. A long time ago it was a large lake.
The infamous Lab X-16 is right beneath us, and I don't feel really comfortable about knowing that...
Sometime after the Zone's appearance, Yantar was chosen as a prime location for the mobile science lab...\nNot the best decision if you ask me.
Hearing stories about the massive zombie waves over here, the psi-emitter is probably bigger than what I imagined.
Damn, I hate this place.
Everyone's favorite evil factory!
Even though the swamp here is small, you can still find your death in there.
A long time ago there was a military operation that went into the lab; it didn't end up well.
I just don't understand the constant stream of monsters coming out of this place - where in the hell are they getting these things?
The scientists have to keep up a large amount of guards to keep the bunker protected.
Got any psy-block? I'd like to retain some brain cells, if that's OK.
This place a diseased look to it.
Getting between the mobile lab and the mercenary base is no walk in the park. It's nearly impossible if the Miracle Machine is on.
I wonder if there are actual bloodsuckers in that abandoned village... On a second thought, never mind.
Those anarchists roam the area, heard they had a hard time defending the Barrier from Monolith forces, heh.
I would keep my ass away from that village if I were you.
The Warehouses are bigger than I expected them to be. Freedom picked an ideal spot for their headquarters.
Freedom kicked the remaining military units out of here after the big emission, they stormed this place and occupied the area.
Mercs usually control the north-eastern outpost, but they never go further than that.
The farm at the northern side is a nice place to hide, only if there's no other squad over there.
Duty usually send their scouts to the farm on that hill.
Watch your head when you cross the village, Burnt Fuzz anomalies are quite common there.
Comet anomalies usually roam the village. It's normal to find fried stalkers lying around the place.
It's rarely quiet here - firefights are very common.
Keep an eye out: we can run into anything in this place.
Hope you brought some firepower.
Can we stay away from the Barrier? Please?
So many ways to go... most of them are bad ways.
Why does it seem like all the bad things the Zone has to offer accumulates at this place?
Smell those fresh corpses.
Freedom can keep the Warehouses and the Barrier - no thanks.
This is where all those creepy radio transmissions come from.
Better be careful: we're not in the nicest neighborhood in the Zone.
Be careful, this place is quite dangerous.
Snorks and poltergeists are quite common around here, keep your eyes open.
Stalkers found rare artefacts here. The underground tunnel is known for nice artefacts, but the amount of Electro anomalies there will change your mind.
The mercs are trying so hard to hold that outpost near the tunnel, but they don't always win.
Some of the worst mutants inhabit the mid area, I heard horrific stories about stalkers dying over here...
The tunnel leading to Yantar has Burners and Comets anomalies, basically a big fucking oven!
Keep your eyes on the vehicles around, snorks usually hide between them.
Here you can find either valuable artefacts, or instant death.
Weird to think that the Bar is a stones-throw away.
There's a thousand little holes for monsters to hide in - this place is a big, nasty lair.
Don't get us lost in here.
There is plenty of fighting here, but stalkers usually have their hands full dealing with mutants.
Going hunting, are we?
This used to be a central hub for the industrial railroad system. Just look at it now.
People usually go in groups through the middle section, and for good reason.
You have my back, right? I can't say I like this place too much.
What a creepy place.
A while ago, I've heard that a group of stalkers saw creepy creatures coming out from the lab around here. Sounds like a bad deal.
This place has always been gloomy.
There's supposed to be a lab somewhere around here...
Freedom used to control the place before the big emission. When they moved to the Army Warehouses, bandits took control here.
This used to be an agricultural research center, sort of like Agroprom. Unlike Agroprom, it was taken over by scum years ago.
Sultan holds sway around here. He lets people pass through if they're on good terms.\nWhich pretty much means you have to pay him.
That pond is nasty - filled with corpses and chemicals and who knows what else.
All sorts of monsters roam this area - you can probably thank the underground lab for that.
Free Stalkers are often to be found at the farm in the south until the thugs come and push them out.
This is the battleground of earlier times. Bandits mostly have it in hand, but they can't quite push the army detachment out of that factory.
What a sad landscape.
I wouldn't want my faction base to be within sight of X-18. No way.
Packs of mutants make incursions from the hills, so be ready with that shooter.
Lots of stalkers died here. This place is no joke.
A friend of mine once told me that Strelok used to have a hideout in the underground tunnels, I wonder what's left of it.
The Ukrainian military controls the area, but that didn't prevent stalkers from sticking around in the utility building.
Duty used to control the research institute before the big emission.
Let's stay out of the underground section, I heard stories about dangerous anomalies and nightmarish creatures flooding the tunnels.
It's strange that the loners hold a settlement so close to the military HQ; it's like they're asking for it.
There are big anomaly fields on top of those eastern hills.
I don't like the thought of standing right over all those tunnels... it's a bad place.
It probably used to be pretty pleasant here.
Those soldiers don't like trespassers around the complex; they're not afraid to gun people down without questions.
Better stick around in a group at night - I think those things crawl up from the underground.
I hope you know where you're going; there are some bad places around here.
Why do I always feel that there's something coming up behind us?
The army presence usually scares the rookies off, so not a terrible place to look for artefacts.
This is one big messy place.
Stay away from the radioactive wastes, I don't want to lose my skin.
What are we doing in the Garbage anyway?
You can never guess what you can find in this graveyard.
Right after the Power Plant's reactor meltdown, whole heaps of radioactive waste were dumped here by the Ukrainian government.
This place swarms with rookie stalkers, with the occasional group of bandits loitering around, always on the lookout for rookies.
There are some artefacts to be found here, but most of them are just not worth the effort.
Loners and bandits are always trying to get their hands onto the best loot, most often leading to fighting and bloodshed.
Bandits had taken hold of the old train hangar for quite a long time.
There's a Duty outpost to the north, on the path which leads to the Bar. They don't let everyone pass through.
The western side is quite dangerous. Mutants hide between the trees over there, waiting for the next free meal to come to them.
If you're looking for artefacts, your best pick would be the vehicle graveyard, or the radioactive swamp on the other side.
People don't come to the Zone for the beauty...
I think I know what rust smells like.
That little vehicle graveyard is a maze of dangerous anomalies.
Some strange people have moved in here recently: there are those shifty guys that run the flea market, as well as an old stalker that goes by "Butcher".
This is as far as many rookies ever get; the ones that have some skills usually make it to the Bar.
Apparently there are some nuts who like to go digging around in the trash piles, but most people just stick to the anomaly fields. They called them the "Diggers", I think.
Hey, wanna have a drink at 100 Rads?
Those freaking megaphones are so loud...
Every time I come in here, that stupid guard tells me to get out of here. Does that fucker think he owns the place or something?
That guard at 100 Rads is a good fella, he always welcomes me inside.
I need to buy some food and ammo from the Barkeep, hope his prices are reasonable.
Duty won't allow anyone go near their headquarters.
I used to enjoy watching the Arena... but I get enough killing out in the Zone. I don't need to see any more.
Safest place in the Zone. If you're on good terms with Duty, that is.
People come here from all over the Zone.
They've done a lot of work to ensure the security of this place. I've heard it wasn't always this way.
You can buy pretty much anything here. And what you can't get here, you can go over to the Freedom base, because they have the rest.
Barkeep has a very particular arrangement with the Duty General; nobody quite knows what the agreement is...
Can you believe this place used to be like the Wild Territory?
The center of the Zone may be the power plant, but this is the center for all of us that happen to be human.
I really shouldn't be doing any drinking... what the hell? Never know when it's going to be your last.
Freedom may have expanded to the north, but Duty still holds the crossroads with a death-grip.
They never can quite snuff out that lair of dogs, huh?
There's always a bunch of drunken sots at the Bar, but there's some solid guys too. All sorts in here.
Duty used to require ID for stalkers to get in here; I've heard that they might start that up again.
You never know who you're going to run into in here: green rookies, scientists, some incognito army soldiers out for a drink, drunk assholes and the occasional legend. I've seen it all.
What's the deal with those guys that are always guarding the Bar? I heard they're twins or something.
I heard there's a proper internet connection around here.
I bet Sid wishes he could get a gig going in here. Then he'd have to give up scamming rookies, of course.
Can you smell that? It's a good smell for once - something cooking, I guess.
This place has seen its fair share of fights. You can still see the scars on the walls.
Just once, I'd like to see someone beat Cardan in arm wrestling. That guy's a beast.
Barkeep's always got a story to tell. Usually a different one each time I come in.
I'd give anything for a comfortable bed and a quiet night's sleep.
This place might be relatively safe, but it's still the Zone. Gotta stay alert.
They say Duty and Freedom might have a truce soon. I'll believe it when I see it.
I heard some Loners are planning a raid on a bandit camp. Probably won't end well.
I don't trust those ecologists. Always poking around where they shouldn't be.
Remember when Beard used to run this place? Things were a lot different back then.
I can't believe I'm saying this, but sometimes I miss the old days.
If we stay here too long, we'll start to grow roots.
Another day, another drink. Cheers to surviving in the Zone.
I wonder what's happening out there while we're in here.
There's always some kind of drama going on at the Bar. Keeps things interesting.
I hope the next round's on you, $name. My pockets are feeling light.
I've had enough of this place. Let's get back out there and face the Zone head-on.
This place gives me the creeps, keep your eyes open and stick close.
Gotta be extra careful, all sorts of dangerous mutants dwell in this place.
It's easy to vanish without leaving a trace here, no matter how lucky you have been in life so far.
I wonder how's that old guy doing these days.
Anomalies are everywhere in the forest, watch your step.
The forest's gate witnessed heavy firefights between different factions. It was never a quiet place.
You may find some rare artefacts in the old mines, but you should know that few stalkers ever return from them.
The Symbiont anomaly lies deep within the forest. It looks like two giant claws.\nIf the rumours are true, it holds all sorts of artefacts inside its core.
Freedom from the south, Monolith from Radar, bandits at the bridge, stalkers near Forester's tower.\nA usual day in the Red Forest.
Did you hear that? Something else is out there...
We could go to the bridge and get killed or we can go in the forest to get killed.\nSo many choices!
Here we are... this place is evil.
We really should stay on the path. Not that the mutants care where we walk...
This place is riddled with caves and old mine shafts. I've heard some really bad things about those places.
I have no idea how Forester holds out against the Monolith. There's something strange about that guy.\nThe Zone likes him or something.
Better watch you step - everything around here wants to kill you.
The air feels heavy here... like the trees are watching us. Stay sharp, this place doesn't forgive mistakes.
Keep your Geiger counter handy. Radiation levels can spike without warning in these parts.
This forest isn't just red in name; blood has soaked into the soil. Don't stray from the group.
Every rustle could be your last. I hate this place more than the garbage dumps back west.
They say the forest grows on the graves of stalkers too greedy or too dumb to turn back. Let's not join them.
Monolith fanatics are the least of our worries in these woods, and that's saying something.
If you see something valuable, think twice before running towards it. Could be an anomaly, or worse.
Forester's not the only hermit around here. There are things in these woods that haven't seen humans for decades.
That howl... it's either a bloodsucker or the ghost of a stalker not lucky enough to die quietly.
Keep an eye on the trees as much as the ground. Snorks love to jump from above.
I've seen things in these woods that would make a burer cry. Watch your back, and maybe watch mine too.
The Red Forest? More like the Dead Forest. You'll see why soon enough...
Remember, if anything happens to me, just tell everyone I died fighting, not running away from a pseudodog.
You feel that? The Zone is alive here... and it's angry. Let's not overstay our welcome.
Can we stay away from this place...
I have a bad feeling about this.
We are crossing the red line, are you sure about what you're doing?
It's easy to vanish without a trace here, no matter how lucky you have been in life so far.
Whoever gets close to the Brain Scorcher immediately goes insane, turns into a zombie and starts stalking the Zone restlessly...
Is visiting this place your greatest idea?!
I'm a bit nervous...
Monolith squads may show up any second now.
The road is patrolled by Monolith forces and the forest is inhabited by the worst kinds of mutants. It's a suicide either way.
Rare artefacts lie deep in the forest. Good luck reaching them.
Watch out! Those vehicles are highly irradiated, keep your distance.
I can hear voices inside my head...
Shit, shit, shit... what are we doing here?
I hope you know what you're doing, buddy.
This place is a shooting gallery manned by fanatics; I'd feel a lot safer if we had a tank...\nOr if we were somewhere else...
This place is a tumor in the middle of the Zone. I wish this whole place was leveled.
The air crackles with more than just radiation here... keep your mind clear, or it'll be overwhelmed by the Scorcher.
Every step here could be your last. This isn't just the heart of the Zone; it's the bleeding edge of hell.
If the mutants don't get you, the Monolith will. And if they don't, the anomalies are hungry too.
Remember, the deeper we go, the thicker the fog of insanity. Watch for signs in each other, alright?
Don't listen to the voices. Don't even acknowledge them. That's how they get you.
The Brain Scorcher's no myth. Keep your psychic dampeners on and your wits about you.
Look at this desolation... The Radar's a graveyard of ambitions and the foolish.
Monolith fanatics think they're protecting paradise, but all they guard is a wasteland of madness.
Keep an eye out for anything unusual. Even the smallest rock might turn out to be an artefact... or a bomb.
This place? It's a madhouse with invisible walls. Don't trust what you see, and even less what you hear.
Watch where you step. The ground here is hungry for more than just our boots.
The Zone's heart beats strongest here in the Radar. It's a pulse that drives weaker men mad.
Radar isn't just a location; it's a test. Survive this, and you're either a hero or a soon-to-be corpse.
Feel that chill? It's not the weather. It's the Scorcher reaching out. Keep your guard up.
I... I can't believe my eyes... we made it to the centre!
I'm still alive...
The centre of the Zone... the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant is lying right in front of us...
We made it...
After all this time, the Power Planet itself...
The centre... we've finally made it to the centre...
I have never been this nervous in my whole life...
We are going to have some stories to tell...
Keep your eyes fucking peeled.
This is where it all started.
Be ready for anything. Shit, what are we doing here?
This place is huge.
We're a long way from the Cordon...
Just think - the Wish Granter could be right over there.
Not many people have seen this place and lived to tell the tale.
I am not prepared for this.
What an empty place, quite depressing actually.
I wonder if we can find anything good inside those buildings.
This used to be a town built for engineers working at the Chernobyl NPP.
What used to be a booming city once is a ghost town now, with mutants and zombies as its only residents.
I've heard that one of those creepy labs is somewhere around here.
Laundromat became a hideout for stalkers.
This bloody place confuses me... where was the entrance we came from?!
The Monolith used to have a psi-emitter in that school, it's broken now.
Department and grocery stores are nearby, wanna go shopping?
The hospital is probably the biggest building around here. Monolith squads might be hiding in there.
One day this whole place will just... crumble away to dust.
These used to be busy streets. Now only the mutants use them.
Easy to get lost in this place - keep your sense of direction.
Let's not wander into a bad neighborhood, eh?
All these places that people lived and died in...\nLook at all these empty shells.
The Pripyat River is close by. You can smell it sometimes.
Monolith are in strength around here - they far outnumber us.
We're not far from the NPP; that means that Monolith are very interested in holding the line.
Nature is reclaiming this city. Maybe it's better to say that the Zone is reclaiming it.
It takes some skill to make it up here.
Watch for snipers in those high-rise ruins. This city's not just dead, it's deadly.
Every corner of this city tells a story of the past, now its just a haunting ground for those damned Monolith freaks.
This place is like a museum of the apocalypse. Except the exhibits can kill you.
Imagine this place before the disaster, bustling with life. Now, look at it, a mere shadow of its former self.
Keep your radio on, and if you see an anomaly, don't be a hero. The hospital isn't taking new patients.
Pripyat's Ferris wheel, a symbol of a funfair that never was. Now it's nothing but a rusty landmark.
That's the Polissya hotel over there. High ground with a view too bad it's probably crawling with gun-toting fanatics.
The Azure Swimming Pool, now a radioactive pit. Dont fall in unless you fancy growing a third eye.
Even the rats here are mutants. You hear that scuttling? Don't wait to find out what it is.
They say the ghosts of the past haunt Pripyat, crying for the lives and dreams left behind.
If you're looking to loot, keep an eye out for booby traps. Desperation turned this place into a minefield.
There's a reason the birds don't sing here anymore. The silence isnt peaceful; it's ominous.
Watch your step, this city's more than just ruins. It's a giant puzzle, each piece more dangerous than the last.
Don't trust the quiet of Pripyat; it's just the storm collecting its breath.
Pripyat might look deserted, but it's teeming with danger. Keep your guard up, or you'll end up another Zone statistic.
Remember, if it comes down to it, better to run and live than fight and die in these streets.
The shadows in Pripyat are long and dark. Perfect for hiding all sorts of nightmares.
Keep your voice down and your weapon ready. You won't see them coming in these blasted ruins.
Stalkers say Pripyat is cursed. Judging by the beasts and bandits that lurk here, I might believe them.
This ghost city has eyes. Feel those chills? That's the gaze of Pripyat, watching us tread its cursed grounds.
All kinds of creatures roam this big area.
I wonder what's inside that big factory.
Heard once that Jupiter was Strelok's preferred area to operate within the Zone.
Freedom managed to take control over the station, after all.
Jupiter is known for having all sorts of mutants around.
This area used to be an active train station before the accident.
My friend told me some stories about the Jupiter factory. He said that many merc and bandit squads vanished there without a trace...
Do you believe stories about the Oasis?
The rail tunnels are known for being inhabited by creepy mutants, mostly groups of burers. Honestly, I would steer clear from them.
The cooling tower offers one hell of a view. People say that spooky distorted radio transmissions can be heard while passing by.
Kopachy village near the cooling tower is swarming with zombies, not to mention the high radiation levels.
Some stalkers found Soul artefacts in the Concrete Bath Anomaly near the factory, I should check that out too.
See the substation workshops over there? The "Quarry" Anomaly is in the middle, right in the swamp. You'll turn into a skeleton in a matter of seconds if you fall into it.
A few years ago, the Ukrainian Military was investigating helicopter crash sites here. There's one in the factory if I'm not mistaken.
You can go through the abandoned underground tunnels to reach the outskirts of Pripyat. Not a bad choice if you want to avoid going through the city's centre.
You can see the whole area if you climb up the old cement factory. It's a perfect spot for sniping.
They say that the Oasis lies beneath the ventilation complex.
Many people talk about the wonderful Oasis, but it seems that nobody has ever seen it. One of our guys said it's like healing waters. If you walk in, your wounds heal and your energy is replenished...
Bandits hide in the container warehouse because it's a remote location.
All sorts of bad things inside the Jupiter Factory. There's a reason why everyone stays way the hell away.
The Red Forest prevents most stalkers from getting here. And don't even mention Radar...
Duty and Freedom used to both inhabit this place. They even shared Yanov station.\nThat would have been quite a thing to see...
I'm not a fan of swampy areas, but this one isn't that bad.
You can find all kind of artefacts here.. and anomalies... and mutants..... Let's just keep moving.
I think I caught bugs in my ass, and staying in this swampy place isn't helping it.
The stalkers at the Skadovsk kicked the bandits out a long time ago.
Zaton is also called "Backwater"... makes sense.
Those rusty ships can save your ass once an unexpected blowout hits.
The trucks on the Preobrazhensky Bridge might contain some forgotten valuables, I should check that out later.
Mercs still hold the waste processing station. They don't allow outsiders to pass through.
Have you seen the Sawmill before? It's usually empty, maybe a few zombies are roaming around.
I heard that many stalkers vanished while exploring the Krug Antenna Complex to the west, better stay away from it...
There's a guy called Noah nearby, my friend told me he tamed a pseudodog! I won't believe him until I see that myself.
Watch out when you go near the fueling station. Many mutants hide there, and they're usually hungry.
The Claw anomaly here in Zaton is probably the biggest of its kind, not to mention all the goodies inside. But be aware of the snorks flooding the caves nearby.
Ever wondered how the Scar anomaly got carved? Just look at it through your PDA's map.
The Circus anomaly has got a fitting name, getting an artefact from there requires constant jumping. Don't forget to bring a good SEVA suit.
You might find an Electro in the Iron Forest anomaly. Be careful though, poltergeists are waiting for careless stalkers.
You can see the power plant from here... damn, we're close.
I've heard there are some really good artefact spots around here. That's probably why Beard came all the way out here.
This used to be a kind of port. Where did all the water go?\nWho the hell knows? Maybe Clear Sky stole it and put it in the swamp.
This area used to be relatively safe. But when the Monolith grew in strength, they started contesting this place.\nIt's not so friendly anymore.
Your name is $name, right? You're new around here or something?
$name?... I don't recall you, you're new here?
You haven't spent much time in the Zone, right $name? Seems like it.
Fresh from the real world, eh $name? Better get used to it.
I've heard you're new around here. What the hell made you enter the Zone?
You're new, right? Well, take it slow and leave the dangerous tasks to the experienced.
Nervous, $name? Don't sweat - we all used to be new once.
I heard new arrivals in the Zone have a one-week survival expectancy.
Do you know what you're doing, $name? Maybe I should be leading...
Pretty new to the Zone, aren't you? You'll learn.
You're not the first clueless fucker to stumble into the Zone, $name. Just make sure you don't end up as mutant chow.
I've seen dumbasses like you come and go. Most don't last long before they're face down in the dirt.
You're still figuring shit out, $name. Just try not to piss off anything bigger than you.
Don't get your fucking hopes up, $name. You're green as shit, and you're gonna learn that the hard way.
You're looking lost as a fucking newborn calf, $name. Need some goddamn pointers before you get yourself killed?
First time in the Zone, $name? Keep your fucking head down and stay close, or you'll be dinner for some fucking bloodsucker.
Still wet behind the ears, huh, $name? Stick with me, and maybe you won't die like a fucking idiot.
Don't get cocky, $name. You're still a fucking rookie, and the Zone eats rookies for breakfast.
Not everyone makes it out of here alive, $name. Don't be another dumb motherfucker who thinks they're invincible.
Stay close, $name. You've got a lot to learn about not being a complete fuckup in the Zone.
Feels good to join a guy who knows what he's doing, $name.
Your name is $name? My PDA says you have quite the experience, glad to have your company.
$name, right? I've heard that you know a thing or two.
Well $name, I know you know what you're doing, so I'll let you take the lead.
You know what? You're not too bad, $name. We could use more like you.
Lead on - you're doing fine so far.
Too many green rookies around here, $name; they just don't have the experience.
Just stay sharp - just because you have some experience doesn't mean shit.
So $name, they tell me you're pretty handy with a shooter.
You've been around, right? So don't lead us into a death-trap. So many people die before they realize what happened.
So you've been around, $name? Don't think that means you're invincible. One wrong move, and you're just another corpse in the Zone.
Starting to gain a bit of a reputation, $name? Don't let it go to your head. There's always someone out there looking to knock you down a peg.
They say you've got potential, $name. Potential don't mean shit if you're dead, though. Keep your wits about you.
Not bad, $name. Not bad at all. But don't think you're hot shit just yet. The Zone has a way of humbling even the best.
Starting to make a name for yourself, huh, $name? Just remember, fame in the Zone can be short-lived if you're not careful.
They say you've been holding your own out here, $name. Let's see if you can keep it up, or if you're just another flash in the pan.
So you're getting a bit of respect around here, $name? Don't let it go to your head. In the Zone, one wrong move can erase any reputation you've built.
You're starting to stand out from the crowd, $name. Just don't let it make you reckless. There's always someone out there looking to knock you down.
So you're not completely useless after all, $name? Well, don't get too cocky. The Zone has a way of humbling even the most capable.
They say you've got some skills, $name. Let's hope you're not just all talk.
You're $name?! I heard a lot about your adventures back at our campfire last night. My friends said you're one of the few who survived a while in the Zone.
You're $name, right?! My friends said you're a real veteran.
$name?! People say you're a real hero. Maybe I can learn from your experience.
You're quite the big deal around here, $name.
$name, huh? You know people are telling stories about you?
I've heard you've seen quite a bit of action. Makes me feel a bit better.
You've probably seen quite a lot in your day, eh $name?
I've heard some of the stunts you've pulled off, $name. I've got to say - you have my respect.
You're one of the Zone success stories, right? Well, good for you.\nYou never know how long it's going to last...
They've been saying you're a lucky one, $name. Apparently, you don't die easily.
So you're the legendary $name, huh? Don't let it go to your head. Legends have a way of becoming cautionary tales.
You're $name, the one who's been making waves in the Zone? Well, let's hope you're not all talk and no action.
They say you've got quite the reputation, $name. Let's see if you live up to it, or if it's all just smoke and mirrors.
So you're the big shot everyone's been talking about, $name? Don't get too comfortable. The Zone has a way of knocking you down a peg when you least expect it.
People are starting to whisper your name, $name. Just remember, fame in the Zone can be fleeting. One wrong move, and you're yesterday's news.
You're $name, the one who's been making headlines? Well, let's see if you're the real deal or just another flash in the pan.
They say you've been turning heads, $name. Just don't let it go to your head. The Zone has a way of humbling even the most celebrated.
So you're the one with all the stories, $name? Well, don't expect everyone to be impressed. In the Zone, actions speak louder than words.
You're starting to carve out a name for yourself, $name. Just remember, reputation means nothing if you can't back it up.
They say you're the one to watch, $name. Let's hope you don't disappoint.
I can't believe it... the living legend, $name himself!
The legendary $name?! I feel blessed already.
Is this real... It's $name! You have my utmost respect.
Honored to be on your team, $name.
So you're $name?\n...I thought you'd be taller.
With you on the team, we're bound to succeed!
It's amazing - you always manage to survive. You've got to teach me that sometime.
Oh, man! Can't believe I'm operating with $name!
This is probably pretty dull for you, right? We mortals, on the other hand, need to be careful.
How many of those stories are true? I imagine you're the kind of person that people make up tales about.
Well, if it isn't the one and only $name! I feel like I should be asking for your autograph or something.
So you're the infamous $name, huh? I gotta say, I expected more... pizzazz.
It's an honor to fight alongside the legendary $name. Let's make some history together.
If you're $name, then this must be a dream. Pinch me, I must be hallucinating.
With $name leading the charge, victory is practically guaranteed! Or so they say...
They say you've stared death in the face and laughed, $name. I hope some of that luck rubs off on me.
So you're the stuff of legends, $name? I guess I should be honored to be in your presence.
They say you're invincible, $name. I guess we'll find out if the rumors are true.
Being on a team with $name feels like being in the presence of greatness. No pressure or anything...
They say you've seen it all, $name. Well, get ready to see even more because I'm tagging along for the ride.
They say $name's been through hell and back. I hope you brought some souvenirs!
So, $name, are the stories true? Or are you just really good at spinning a yarn?
If half the stories about $name are true, then we're in for one hell of a ride.
They say you've got nerves of steel, $name. Let's hope they're right.
If it isn't the one and only $name! I've heard stories about you. Some of them are even true.
Hey, $name! If you're half as good as they say you are, we'll breeze through this.
I heard $name once took down a pack of bloodsuckers single-handedly. Let's see if the legend holds up.
If you're $name, then I'm in good company. Let's show these Zone bastards what we're made of!
They say you're the best of the best, $name. Well, I'm here to see if the hype is real.
So you're the one they call $name? I've gotta admit, I'm impressed.
You're $name? I've heard that you did some bad shit...
You're $name? You've got quite the "reputation" around here.
$name? I think I've heard about you, some people are quite angry due to your actions.
People say you fucked up big time, $name. What have you done exactly?
$name? Even the mutants have better manners than you, I've heard.
So you're $name? I hope half the stories they tell about you aren't true.
$name, huh? Your reputation's so foul I could smell it over the anomalies.
Ah, $name! The person who's been pissing off every faction. Got any friends left?
$name? Your deeds stink more than a bloodsucker's den. Watch your back.
You're $name? Looks like every shit story in the Zone has your name on it.
$name... Even the rookies know better than to mess up like you did.
$name, right? Heard you've been making more enemies than the Monolith. Careful now.
$name? I'd rather team up with a snark. At least they stab you from the front.
You must be $name. The Zones own walking disaster. Stay clear of me.
Oh, $name? There's a bounty on screw-ups like you. Maybe I'll collect.
$name, the Zone's pariah. Bet you've got more enemies than artifacts.
They said watch out for $name. You do bad and worse follows. You're proof of that.
$name? A stalker said youre the reason they lock their stashes. Made lots of friends, eh?
So youre $name? You've got a rep for turning good situations bad, real fast.
Ah, $name, the one who'd sell their own grandma for a handful of rubles. Nice to meet you, I guess.
$name? Shit, even the garbage around here smells better than your rep.
You're $name? Fuck me, you're the asshole who's been screwing everyone over!
$name? Heard you're the kind of prick whod shoot a man over a can of pork. Stay the fuck away.
So you're $name? I'd shake your hand but I like my fingers where they are, you thieving cunt.
Ah, $name! Rumor has it you'd fuck your own mother for a few extra bullets.
$name, huh? They say even the dogs around here piss on your name. Watch your back.
$name? Your deeds reek worse than a mutants arse. Got no friends here, fucker.
You're $name? Damn, hope my luck ain't that bad to get stuck with you.
$name? Even the bandits talk about what a backstabbing bitch you are.
You must be $name. The one who'd sell their soul for a clip of ammo. Pathetic.
Oh, its $name. The Zone's very own fuck-up fairy. You touch it, it turns to shit.
So you're the infamous $name? Id sooner team up with a blind bloodsucker than trust you.
$name, right? Heard you're the type of lowlife who'd rob a dead man's eyes. Fuck off.
$name! Even your shadow knows better than to stick around. You're fucked up.
Hey, $name, the shit-stirrer! You walk, trouble follows. Just keep walking, pal.
Look who it is: $name, the Zone's favorite asshole. Heard you've fucked over enough folks to start a club.
$name, huh? I'd tell you to go to hell, but I think you just came from there.
$name! Mother Natures mistake. Why the fuck are you still breathing?
$name? I'd rather kiss a snork than see your face. Piss off.
You're $name? Shit, and here I was thinking today was going well.
$name... I don't recall your name.
Your reputation seems fine enough, $name.
$name, you seem like a nice guy. Are you new around here?
My PDA doesn't show much info about you $name. That's a good thing, I suppose.
Don't take this the wrong way, $name, but you're kind of a boring guy.
Pretty quiet, aren't you? Well, I guess you're alright.
You know, I've not heard of you before, $name.\nThat's probably good though - the ones that stick their heads out usually don't last long.
Lots of scary people around, $name. Are you a guy I can trust?
$name, huh? You keep things low-key, I respect that.
You're $name? I've heard very little, and that's often a good thing here.
$name, right? I appreciate someone who can keep their head down. Stay sharp.
Not much noise about you, $name. In the Zone, silence is golden.
You're $name? You dont make waves. I like that.
$name? Youve managed to stay under the radar. Smart move.
Heard your name, $name, but nothing bad. Thats as good as a badge of honor around here.
$name... You're not exactly famous, but you're not infamous either. That's a fine line to walk.
You're $name? Can't say I know much, but no news is good news, right?
$name, a neutral guy in a land of extremes. Keep playing it safe.
So you're $name. You dont stir the pot. Thats rare. Keep it up.
$name, I've barely heard a peep about you. Either you're slick, or you're careful. Either's good.
$name? You seem alright. Havent heard you've kicked any puppies, at least.
They say if youre not known by your enemies, $name, youre doing something right.
$name, you're not making enemies. That's a smart way to live around here.
$name? Yeah, I know the name. No drama? Good for you.
$name... No bad tales on the wind about you. That's commendable.
You're $name right? I've heard good stuff about you the other day, keep it up.
Your name is $name? I've heard that you help stalkers around, that's so nice of you.
$name? I heard about you the other day, you've got a good reputation among stalkers.
I think I heard about you, $name. My friends said you're good at what you're doing.
People say that you're a man of your word, $name. I'm glad to join your team.
I know you're not like these other guys around here, $name. They're all a bunch of backstabbers, I'm telling you.
You're pretty solid, $name; I think you know what you're doing.
You should be careful, $name: I think that good ones like you usually don't make it out here.\nThe cockroaches always survive...
$name? Yeah, I've seen you around doing good. It's a breath of fresh air in this toxic wasteland.
Hey $name, I've heard you're one of the few who play it straight. Respect.
Ah, you're $name! Word is you're one of the good ones. We could use more like you.
$name, right? Folks say you're helping make the Zone a bit less shitty. Keep it up.
So you're $name! People talk about the lives you've saved. Thats damn honorable.
I've heard you're $name. Stalkers are safer because of you. Glad you're here.
Oh, you're $name! Heard you pulled some folks out of a tight spot. Impressive.
You're $name, arent you? Heard youre not just another greedy bastard. Thats rare.
$name? Nice to meet someone whos not out just for themselves for once.
You're $name! Finally, someone who knows how to handle their shit without stirring up a storm.
$name! The word is you've got a decent head on your shoulders. Not many left with one around here.
Hey, $name, good to see someone with principles these days. We need more of that.
They say youre a decent sort, $name. In times like these, thats something.
Good to meet you, $name. I hear you're one of the few good guys left. Lets try to keep it that way.
You must be $name. Heard you did some solid work recently. It's appreciated.
$name, right? Word around the fire is that youre someone we can count on.
Youre $name? Heard you're the kind whod give your last medkit to save a fellow stalker. Nice.
Oh! $what! Right in time to get patched up.
$what. Not too bad. It's hard to find supplies like this lying around.
Who's buying medical supplies for the best available prices? I've got $what, and I don't have much use for it.
Goddammit $what! I got this for triple the price from some trader the other day.
$what! Finally! Time to heal up.
Found $what. Should I sell it? Or just take it for myself...?
Hey! Didn't one of you almost kick the bucket a second ago? Will $what be of any help?
Let's see what we got here... $what! Nice! That'll be of use.
$what? Shit, thats like gold dust around here. Good find!
Who knew $what would be as valuable as an artifact? At least it doesn't irradiate your balls off.
Stumbled upon some $what. This stuff's better than vodka for numbing the pain.
Just when I thought we were out of luck, I found some $what. We might just survive another day.
$what, anyone? Or are you all planning to limp around bleeding? Speak now, or forever hold your guts.
I'll trade my last bottle of vodka for some $what. Yes, its that serious.
Look what the cat dragged in... $what! Anyone need patching up?
Managed to get my hands on $what. This shit might just make me the most popular guy in camp.
Got $what today. Either Im healing up or starting my own clinic. Bids start at two artifacts!
$what is up for grabs. Who feels like they might take a bullet today?
If you need $what, come find me. Bring ammo, I aint running a charity here.
Anyone else need $what? Because at this rate, we'll be out by tomorrow.
Fresh stock of $what just came in. Get it before the bloodsuckers do!
$what on deck. If you're shot, cut, or bitten, line up with your trade goods ready.
Anyone tired of bleeding out? I've got $what, and it's going fast.
Finally got some $what. Its about damn time; my stash was looking like a bandits conscience.
