$what in hand. Guess I'm the camp nurse now. Who's first?
Guess what I found? $what! It's like stumbling upon a treasure chest in the wasteland.
Just stumbled upon some $what. It's a culinary miracle in this post-apocalyptic world.
Scored some $what! Who needs luck when you've got scavenging skills like mine?
Found a stash of $what near the old reactor. Looks like Chernobyl's still giving us gifts.
Traded some old magazines for a stash of $what. Who knew paper could be so valuable?
Just bartered my last pack of smokes for some delicious $what. Looks like it's time to kick the habit.
Managed to trade some old tools for a hefty supply of $what. Looks like manual labor pays off in more ways than one.
Found a hidden cache of $what near the old military outpost. Seems like someone's stash was left unguarded.
Just bartered my last pair of boots for some prime $what. Who needs footwear when you've got a full stomach?
Traded my last artifact for a stash of $what. Guess it's time to let go of the past and embrace the present feast.
Scavenged some fresh $what near the old abandoned factory. Looks like industrial wastelands have their perks.
Managed to trade some mutant parts for a delicious supply of $what. Who knew killing mutants could be so rewarding?
Found a trader selling $what near the old train station. Better grab 'em before someone else does.
Just traded my last bottle of vodka for some tasty $what. Looks like sobriety has its culinary perks.
Scored some premium $what from a traveling merchant. Looks like the road to good eats is paved with trade.
Managed to barter some electronic components for a fresh supply of $what. Looks like technology has its benefits after all.
Found a hidden cache of $what near the old research facility. Looks like scientific experiments do have practical applications.
Just bartered my last spare parts for some premium $what. Who knew hoarding junk could lead to culinary delights?
Traded my last bandage for a stash of $what. Hope I won't need medical attention after this delicious meal.
Found a trader selling $what near the old factory ruins. Better stock up on supplies while they last.
Managed to barter some mutant guts filled with "artefacts" hehe for a fresh supply of $what haha what an idiot
Found a stash of $what near the old abandoned warehouse. Looks like someone forgot their emergency provisions.
Just traded my last artifact for some tasty $what. Looks like it's time to say goodbye to ancient relics and hello to a full stomach.
Scavenged some fresh $what near the old military checkpoint. Looks like military outposts have their hidden treasures.
Got my hands on some premium $what from a friendly trader. Looks like good food can be found in unexpected places.
Managed to trade some rare artifacts for a stash of $what. Who knew ancient relics could be so tasty?

$speaker checking in: Secure hold at $map has been achieved. Recon teams are active, and we are monitoring enemy channels for any sign of a counter-attack. The situation is stable but tense. Ready for further commands.

$speaker here: Complete control of $map has been established after a robust offensive. We're now in the process of mining access points and setting up long-range patrols. Awaiting further strategic orders.

$speaker on the line: $map is now ours, fuckers couldn't hold their ground. We're dug in like ticks and waiting to jump on the next batch of poor bastards who try us. What's the next move?

$speaker here: Weve locked down $map. The enemy's had their asses handed to them and we're sniffing around for stragglers. This place will be a graveyard before we let it go. Whats next?

$speaker calling in: Secured $map after tearing through the enemy like a hot knife through butter. Our guns are up and roaring; let's see who dares to step up next. Command, your orders?
This is $speaker. $map's ours, and we're not just sitting ducks here; we've got traps set all around. Let those bastards come back and see what's waiting. Ready for the next kill order.
Hey, it's $speaker. We've made $map our bitch. Got the perimeter wired with explosives and watching the shadows. Anyone comes sniffing around will get a face full of lead. Awaiting what fun comes next.
$speaker reporting: Took $map with extreme prejudice. Enemies are wiped, and were watching the rats run. All set for a night of long knives if they try their luck. Command, where to unleash us next?
From $speaker at $map: Areas locked tighter than a drum. We blasted those fucks out and now we're ready to paint the map red with anyone dumb enough to retake it. What's our next pleasure?

Were the apex predators here. They were just lunch.

They underestimated our resolve. A fatal mistake.

The Zone is a harsh judge. They were found wanting.

Were the apex predators of the Zone. They were just a light snack.
They thought they could challenge us? Bless their hearts. And their gear.
Another group silenced. The Zone is a peaceful place now. Relatively speaking. For us, anyway.
Theyre just another cautionary tale for anyone foolish enough to cross our path. Or even think about it.

Theyre just another example of why you dont mess with us. Ever. Got it?
Their time in the Zone is up. Ours isnt. Yet.. Knock on wood.
Theyre just another stain on the landscape. A reminder of what happens to those who cross us. Or even look at us funny.
Were the storm that sweeps through the Zone. They were just caught in the crossfire. Tough luck.
They came looking for trouble. They found it. And it killed them. Serves them right.
Their luck ran out. Ours didnt. Thats the way the Zone crumbles. One body at a time.
Theyre just another notch on our guns. And another story to tell around the campfire. Assuming we survive to tell it.
The Zone is a cruel mistress. But she favors the strong. And were strong. And well-armed.
Theyre just another reason why you should fear us. Respect us. Obey us. Or die trying.
Their journey ends here. Ours continues. For now. The Zone is a long and winding road.
Theyre just another sacrifice to the Zone. Were the ones who collect the offerings. And the loot.
Hopefully there's no mutants in $where, we got a tough mission ahead of us.
I hate getting deployed to $where, let's get in and out quick.
I always love missions in $where. High risk, high reward.
I always love missions in $where. High risk, high reward.
Heading to $where. Lets hope the pay is worth it this time.
$where again? Feels like this place has it out for us.
Every stalker has a story about $where. Lets make ours a good one.
$where, huh? Id rather be anywhere else, but duty calls.
Last time I was in $where, things got messy. Lets be smarter this time.
If youre heading to $where, you better be ready for anything.
Mutants, anomalies, and bandits $where has it all. Lucky us.
Cant believe theyre sending us to $where. Someone really hates us.
$where is like a bad dream you just hope to wake up alive.
They say no one leaves $where unscathed. Lets prove them wrong.
Why is it always $where? Someone else should deal with this mess.
Ive got a bad feeling about $where. Stick close and stay sharp.
$where isnt a place for rookies. Lets show them what were made of.
Well need more than luck to get through $where in one piece.
Argh! I'm injured, cover me while I use meds.
Damnit I'm hit.
We're taking fire out here!
They got me! Cover me while I use a tourniquet.
Shit! That one got me good, I need a moment.
Ah, hell, Im bleeding out here! Keep them off me!
That was too close... gotta patch myself up!
Cover me! Im not dying out here!
Feels like I got hit by a damn truck! Medkit time.
Im not ready to die yet! Hold them off while I fix this.
Bleeding pretty bad over here... need a few seconds!
This ones gonna leave a mark. Applying meds now.
They clipped me! Watch my back while I stop the bleeding!
Hold on, this isnt how I go out! Give me a minute.
Damn it, Im hit! Dont let them get any closer!
I need to stop the bleeding, or this is it for me.
Stay sharp, Im patching myself up here!
Got hit bad, dont let them flank us while I heal!
That was my last AI-2 kit...
Ah nothing like a warm fire...
Good warmthhelps shake off the damp ruins smell after a long trek.
Keep your back to the flames; those trees hide rail-gun anomalies a few paces off.
Hearing that static? Could be an artifact generator feeding off the embers.
Careful where you toss that tinhot shards can set off strange gravity pockets.
Id trade this fire for a clean deal with the tradersartifact prices keep climbing.
Once youve eaten stew boiled over a campfire, how can you go back to canned rations
Not a whisper from the Monolith fanatics tonightlucky for our hides.
Watch that smoke plume, mutants smell it long before they see us moving.
Anyone share a cigarette? Been a long fucking day. Chilling by the fire
Heard Monolith patrols moving through the ruinsbest keep our fire low.
Swap me your spare filters? This smokes thick enough to draw a SIN squad.
Rumor says Renegades found a Gravi-Sphere artifact near the old labcrazy price tag.
Dont get too cozy,those logs can roll right into a hidden Monolith anomaly.
Saw a Renegade scout skulking by earlier. Must be hunting our trail.
Keep your chatter down, SIN command posts pick up voices over these crackles.
Monolith fanatics wont appreciate us stealing their scorch marks.
Pass that canteen, waters precious here, especially when SIN blockades run dry.
Renegades hijacked our last supply drop, left us scrambling for ammo.
Artifact detectors glitch near Monolith breaches, watch your step by the fire.
After all these years of the Zone's Existence I heard that the anomalies have gotten worse
They say the Gravi-Sphere artifact can bend metalbut at the cost of a stalkers sanity.
Some claim you can hear whispers in the anomaly Whisper, but only when youre carrying an artifact.
Crystalized emission samples can fetch more rubles than rare artifacts, if you can collect them safely.
Bloodsuckers avoid the Geiger anomaly, it emits a pulse they find nearly intolerable.
Boil-off water from thermobaric anomalies has been used to power camp stovesjust make sure its filtered.
Artifacts sometimes phase back into an anomaly if you try to carry too many, leaving you empty-handed.
Radiation readings spike right before a burst anomaly, watch your detector for sudden jumps.
Old research notes mention a sleeping artifact that only activates when left alone for days.
Even seasoned stalkers double-check their gear after a shockwave passes, it can scramble electronics.
Funny how every stalker thinks theyve seen it all, then the Zone surprises them again.
They say a hot cup of tea tastes like heaven after crawling through those tunnels.
Some old-timers swear that whistling calms the Mutants, worth a try if youre cornered.
Never trust a map that came from a trader, you might end up in someone elses ambush.
Theres nothing like swapping stories by a fire, until someone mentions their buddy who never left.
If you find a lost PDA, skim through the notes, might learn a trick or two about the Zone.
Rains a blessingyou can cool down a hot weapon and wash the stink off your jacket.
Heard laughter echo through one of the under tunnels once, turned out to be a lone stalker talking to himself...i dipped
A little bartering goes a long way, never underestimate the power of a friendly smile.
They say the Zone remembers faces, so be ready for an old rival to show up when you least expect it.
Funny how the quietest corners of the Zone make you feel the loudest.
CAN I GET A FUCKING BREAK FOR ONCE FUCKKK.
They say sharing a smoke can turn strangers into allies for one night, at least.
Keep your boots oiled, nothing worse than a squeak giving you away.
Candles are a luxury, but they beat fighting shadows in an underground bunker.
If you hum a tune, dont be surprised when the wind carries it back fourfold.
Old folks swear that a friendly whistle scares off more than just mutants.
I used to be a talker, this place has too many reasons to fall silent.
Trust your gut more than your compassanomalies dont read maps.
Never underestimate the comfort of dry socks and the misery of wet ones.
